questions.Question: For a spontaneous chemical process, the free energy change is
questions.optionD: Depends on whether the reaction is exothermic or endothermic
questions.solution: Solution:		For a spontaneous chemical process, the free energy change is negative.

questions.Question: When a bond is formed between two atoms, the energy of the system will
questions.solution: Solution:		When a bond is formed between two atoms the energy of the system will decrease.

questions.Question: The minimum energy required for an effective collision is
questions.solution: Solution:		The minimum amount of energy that molecules must have in order for a reaction to occur upon collision is called activation energy.

questions.Question: Which of the following produces highest amount of energy upon oxidation?
questions.solution: Solution:		Fats consist of a wide group of compounds that are generally soluble in organic solvents and generally insoluble in water. Chemically, fats are triglycerides, triesters of glycerol and any of several fatty acids. Fats may be either solid or liquid at room temperature, depending on their structure and composition. Although the words “oils”, “fats”, and “lipids” are all used to refer to fats, “oils” is usually used to refer to fats that are liquids at normal room temperature, while “fats” is usually used to refer to fats that are solids at normal room temperature. Fats also serve as energy stores for the body, containing about 37.8 kilojoules (9 calories) per gram of fat. They are broken down in the body to release glycerol and free fatty acids. The glycerol can be converted to glucose by the liver and thus used as a source of energy.

questions.Question: Which of the following has least negative electron gain enthalpy?
questions.solution: Solution:		The element with the most negative electron gain enthalpy is chlorine, and the one with the least negative electron gain enthalpy is phosphorus.

questions.Question: The material used in the manufacture of lead pencil is
questions.solution: Solution:		Pencils create marks via physical abrasion, leaving behind a trail of solid core material that adheres to a sheet of paper or other surface. They are noticeably distinct from pens, which dispense liquid or gel ink that stain the light colour of the paper. Most pencil cores are made of graphite mixed with a clay binder, leaving grey or black marks that can be easily erased. Graphite pencils are used for both writing and drawing, and the result is durable: although writing can usually be removed with an eraser, it is resistant to moisture, most chemicals, ultraviolet radiation and natural aging. Other types of pencil core are less widely used. Charcoal pencils are mainly used by artists for drawing and sketching.

questions.Question: Water can be separated from alcohol water mixture by
questions.solution: Solution:		To separate a mixture of alcohol (ethanol) and water, you can use a process known as fractional distillation. This technique relies on the fact that the compounds in the mixture have different boiling points. Since ethanol boils at a lower temperature (78.5 degrees Celsius) than water, the alcohol vaporizes while most of the water remains a liquid.

questions.Question: In addition to hydrogen, the other abundant element present on Sun’s surface is
questions.solution: Solution:		The Sun is composed primarily of the chemical elements hydrogen and helium; they account for 74.9% and 23.8% of the mass of the Sun in the photosphere, respectively. All heavier elements, called metals in astronomy, account for less than 2% of the mass. The Sun inherited its chemical composition from the interstellar medium out of which it formed: the hydrogen and helium in the Sun were produced by Big Bang nucleosynthesis.

questions.Question: The most abundant element by number in the living system is :
questions.solution: Solution:		In sequential order, Hydrogen, Oxygen, Carbon and Nitrogen are the most abundant elements by number in the living system. Hydrogen constitutes 49.8% of living systems, while Oxygen constitutes 24.9%; Carbon and Nitrogen account for 24.9% and 0.27% respectively. It is not surprising, therefore, that the living cell is between 60% and 90% water.

questions.Question: What is the element required for solar energy conversion ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Photovoltaics (PV) use silicon solar cells to convert the energy of sunlight into electricity. Operates under the photoelectric effect which results in the emission of electrons.

questions.Question: Activated Charcoal is used to remove colouring matter from pure substances by
questions.solution: Solution:		Activated charcoal is used to remove colouring matter from pure substances. It works by adsorption. Colour impurities are adsorbed on the surface of activated charcoal.

questions.Question: The molecular mass of a gas is
questions.optionD: Not related to its vapour pressure
questions.solution: Solution:		The molecular mass of a gas is twice its vapour pressure.

questions.Question: The value of gas constant R in Ergs deg–1 mole–1 is
questions.solution: Solution:		The universal gas constant R signifies the work done by or on a gas per mole per kelvin. The SI unit of R is J mole-1 K-1 and its value is 8.314 J mole-1 K-1. In CGS unit, the value of R is 1.98 cal mol-1 °C-1.

questions.Question: The absolute temperature of a gas is doubled and the pressure is reduced to half, the volume of the gas
questions.solution: Solution:		The absolute temperature of a gas is doubled and the pressure is reduced to half, the volume of the gas will increase four-fold.

questions.Question: Isobars are lines joining places having equal
questions.solution: Solution:		Isobars are imaginary lines joining the places having equal values of pressure. Closely spaced isobars indicate strong pressure gradient and widely spaced isobars indicate weak pressure gradient.

questions.Question: Which of the following phenomenon is considered responsible for Global Warming?
questions.solution: Solution:		Modern global warming is the result of an increase in magnitude of the so-called greenhouse effect, a warming of Earth's surface and lower atmosphere caused by the presence of water vapour, carbon dioxide, methane, nitrous oxides, and other greenhouse gases.

questions.Question: The nucleus of an atom consists of
questions.solution: Solution:		The nucleus of an atom consists of protons and neutrons.

questions.Question: The number of moles of solute present in 1 kg of a solvent is called its
questions.solution: Solution:		Molality is the property of a a solution that is defined as the number of moles of solute per kilogram of solvent.

questions.Question: The most electronegative element among the following is
questions.solution: Solution:		Fluorine is the most electronegative element and also the most reactive non-metal.

questions.Question: The metal used to recover copper from a solution of copper sulphate is
questions.solution: Solution:		The metal used to recover copper from a solution of copper sulphate is Fe.

questions.Question: When a spoon is to be electroplated with nickel the spoon is
questions.optionA: Dipped in a nickel sulphate solution
questions.optionB: Made anode and a pure nickel rod, the cathode
questions.optionC: Made cathode and a pure nickel red, the anode
questions.optionD: Coated with nickel sulphate and dried
questions.solution: Solution:		Electroplating is the deposition by electrolysis of a coating of metal upon a conducting surface. The simplest system makes the object to be plated the negative electrode (cathode) or plate in a galvanic couple. Thus a spoon or other object may be connected by a wire to a plate of nickel. The process that occurs on the spoon is called reduction and, therefore, the spoon is also referred to as a cathode.

questions.Question: Conversion of chemical energy into electrical energy occurs in
questions.solution: Solution:		The chemical energy in food is converted by the body into mechanical energy and heat. The chemical energy in coal is converted into electrical energy at a power plant. The chemical energy in a battery can also supply electrical power by means of electrolysis.

questions.Question: The process of covering water pipes made of Iron with Zinc layer to prevent corrosion is called :
questions.solution: Solution:		Galvanization or galvanizing (also spelled galvanisation or galvanising) is the process of applying a protective zinc coating to steel or iron, to prevent rusting. The most common method is hot-dip galvanizing, in which the parts are submerged in a bath of molten hot zinc.

questions.Question: Galvanization of iron is carried out using
questions.solution: Solution:		Galvanisation or galvanization (or galvanizing as it is most commonly called) is the process of applying a protective zinc coating to iron or steel, to prevent rusting. The most common method is hot dip galvanizing, in which steel sections are submerged in a bath of molten zinc.

questions.Question: The working of a dry cell is based on
questions.solution: Solution:		A dry cell is a type of battery that uses a paste electrolyte, with only enough moisture to allow current to flow. It works in accordance with Faraday’s law of electrolysis. It consists of an outer case made of zinc (the negative electrode), a carbon rod in the center of the cell (the positive electrode), and the space between them is filled with an electrolyte paste. In operation the electrolyte, causes the electrons to flow and produce electricity.

questions.Question: Highly toxic gas which causes headache, visual difficulty, paralysis and even death is
questions.solution: Solution:		Carbon monoxide intoxication can be caused by single or repetitively generated high short-term peaks, and carbon monoxide poisoning is the leading cause of death from poisoning (accidental and intentional).

questions.Question: Water gas is the combination of
questions.solution: Solution:		Water-gas A mixture of carbon monoxide (CO) and hydrogen (H2) produced by passing steam over red-hot coke using the endothermic reaction.

questions.Question: The gas that causes suffocation and death when coal or coke is burnt in a closed room is
questions.solution: Solution:		Exhaust fumes of motor cars, gases produced from coal fire in a closed room and coal gas, all contain carbon monoxide, which is the cause of their poisonous nature. When carbon monoxide is inhaled, it prevents the oxygen from combining with hemoglobin and instead combines itself with hemoglobin to form carboxyhaemoglobin, which is stable compound. This causes oxygen starvation in the body tissues and eventually causes death by suffocation.

questions.Question: Which one is not a pure form of carbon?
questions.solution: Solution:		There are many pure forms of carbon in earth, but Diamond is the purest form of carbon. Other pure forms are graphite, fullerene and charcoal. Gold is not a form of carbon.

questions.Question: Which one is the purest form of carbon?
questions.solution: Solution:		There are many pure forms of carbon in earth, but Diamond is the purest form of carbon. Other pure forms are graphite, fullerene and charcoal.

questions.Question: Which among the following metals provides amphoteric oxide ?
questions.solution: Solution:		In chemistry, an amphoteric compound is a molecule or ion that can react both as an acid and as a base. Many metals (such as copper, zinc, tin, lead, aluminium, and beryllium) form amphoteric oxides or hydroxides. Amphoterism depends on the oxidation states of the oxide.

questions.Question: Impure camphor is purified by
questions.solution: Solution:		Sublimation apparatus is a piece of laboratory glassware used in the technique of sublimation usually used by chemists to purify compounds. Typically a solid is placed in a vessel which is then heated under vacuum. Under this reduced pressure the solid volatilizes and condenses as a purified compound on a cooled surface, leaving the non-volatile residue impurities behind. This cooled surface often takes the form of a cold finger. Once heating ceases and the vacuum is released, the sublimed compound can be collected from the cooled surface. Impure camphor is purified by this process.

questions.Question: Iron filings can be separated from a heterogeneous mixture using the technique of :
questions.solution: Solution:		The method of separation using magnets is used when one of the components is magnetic. So the heterogeneous mixture of iron filings and some other material (such as sulphur powder) can be separated by using magnets. Similarly, a mixture of sand and iron filings can be separated by magnet.

questions.Question: Electric bulbs are filled with :
questions.solution: Solution:		Filling a bulb with an inert gas such as argon or nitrogen slows down the evaporation of the tungsten filament compared to operating it in a vacuum.

questions.Question: The most abundant inert gas in the atmosphere is
questions.solution: Solution:		The most abundant inert gas in the atmosphere is Argon.

questions.Question: The main buffer system of the human blood is
questions.solution: Solution:		Bicarbonate buffer is the most important buffer system in blood plasma (generally in the extracellular fluid). This buffer consists of weak acid H2CO3(pK1 = 6,1) and conjugated base HCO3- (bicarbonate).

questions.Question: The gas present in the stratosphere which filters out some of the sun's ultraviolet light and provides an effective shield against radiation damage to living things is
questions.solution: Solution:		Although ozone (O3) is present in small concentrations throughout the atmosphere, most ozone (about 90%) exists in the stratosphere, in a layer between 10 and 50 km above the surface of the earth. This ozone layer performs the essential task of filtering out most of the sun's biologically harmful UV radiation.

questions.Question: The most commonly used bleaching agent is
questions.solution: Solution:		Most commonly used bleaching agent is chlorine. The most widely used bleach in the United States is liquid chlorine bleach, an alkaline aqueous solution of sodium hypochlorite.

questions.Question: The nucleus of a hydrogen atom consists of
questions.solution: Solution:		Most hydrogen atoms have nuclei that consist of a single proton, but a small fraction (about 0.015 percent) of the hydrogen atoms that occur in Nature have one neutron in addition to the proton in their nuclei.

questions.Question: The heat required to raise the temperature of body by 1 K is called
questions.solution: Solution:		The heat required to raise the temperature of a body by 1 K is called thermal capacity. In other words, when q is the heat supplied to the body and the temperature raises by 1 K, then the thermal capacity of body is q.

questions.Question: Milk is
questions.solution: Solution:		Milk is emulsion.

questions.Question: Milk is a natural
questions.solution: Solution:		An emulsion is a mixture of two or more liquids that are normally immiscible (nonmixable or unblendable). Emulsions are part of a more general class of two-phase systems of matter called colloids. Although the terms colloid and emulsion are sometimes used interchangeably, emulsion should be used when both the dispersed and the continuous phase are liquids. In an emulsion, one liquid (the dispersed phase) is dispersed in the other (the continuous phase). Examples of emulsions include vinaigrettes, milk, mayonnaise, and some cutting fluids for metal working. The photo-sensitive side of photographic film is also an example of a colloid. The word “emulsion” comes from the Latin word for “to milk”, as milk is (among other things) an emulsion of milk fat and water.

questions.Question: Emulsifier is an agent which
questions.solution: Solution:		An emulsifier is a substance that stabilizes an emulsion by increasing its kinetic stability. One class of emulsifiers is known as “surface active substances”, or surfactants. Many different emulsifiers are used in pharmacy to prepare emulsions such as creams and lotions. Common examples include emulsifying wax, cetearyl alcohol, polysorbate 20, and ceteareth 20. Sometimes the inner phase itself can act as an emulsifier, and the result is a nanoemulsion, where the inner state disperses into “nano-size” droplets within the outer phase. A well-known example of this phenomenon, the “Ouzo effect”, happens when water is poured into a strong alcoholic anise-based beverage, such as ouzo, pastis, arak, or raki. The anisolic compounds, which are soluble in ethanol, then form nano-size droplets and emulsify within the water. The resulting colour of the drink is opaque and milky white.

questions.Question: An emulsifier is an agent which
questions.optionB: Aids the flocculation of an emulsion
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Muddy water is treated with alum in purification process, it is termed as :
questions.solution: Solution:		Natural and wastewater contain small particulates that are suspended in water forming a colloid. These particles carry the same charges, and repulsion prevents them from combining into larger particulates to settle. Historically, dirty water is cleaned by treating with alum, Al2(SO4)3.12 H2O, and lime, Ca(OH)2. The phenomenon is known as coagulation.

questions.Question: Which type of fire extinguisher is used for petroleum fire ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Foam type extinguisher is used for petroleum fire.

questions.Question: Man dies in the atmosphere of CO, because it
questions.optionB: Combines with O2 present in the body
questions.optionC: Reduces the organic matter of tissues
questions.optionD: Combines with the haemoglobin of blood, thereby making the later incapable of absorbing O2
questions.solution: Solution:		The preferential binding of carbon monoxide to iron severely limits the oxygen to bind to hemoglobin. As a result, less oxygen is carried through our system and we die.

questions.Question: It is dangerous to leave the car engine running in a closed garage, because it may cause serious pollution due to poisoning by emission of
questions.solution: Solution:		The extremely high concentrations of carbon monoxide produced by an engine can raise CO concentrations in a closed building so quickly that a person may collapse before they even realize there is a problem. Carbon monoxide reduces the amount of oxygen to the brain, causing CO intoxication, and lack of reasoning. Hence option D is correct answer.

questions.Question: Which gas is used as fire extinguisher ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Carbon dioxide is used as fire extinguisher.

questions.Question: The process which does not evolve CO2 in air is
questions.solution: Solution:		The process which does not evolve CO2 in air is photosynthesis.

questions.Question: Carbon monoxide is an inflammable gas. Which one of the following is also inflammable?
questions.solution: Solution:		At standard temperature and pressure, hydrogen is a colourless, odorless, tasteless, non-toxic, nonmetallic, highly combustible diatomic gas with the molecular formula H2. Naturally occurring atomic hydrogen is rare on Earth because hydrogen readily forms covalent compounds with most elements and is present in the water molecule and in most organic compounds. Hydrogen plays a particularly important role in acid-base chemistry with many reactions exchanging protons between soluble molecules. Hydrogen gas (dihydrogen or molecular hydrogen) is highly flammable and will burn in air at a very wide range of concentrations between 4% and 75% by volume. The enthalpy of combustion for hydrogen is 286 kJ/mol. Pure hydrogen-oxygen flames emit ultraviolet light and are nearly invisible to the naked eye, as illustrated by the faint plume of the Space Shuttle Main Engine compared to the highly visible plume of a Space Shuttle Solid Rocket Booster.

questions.Question: When Hydrogen starts burning in air, it produces ?
questions.solution: Solution:		In a flame of pure hydrogen gas, burning in air, the hydrogen (H2) reacts with oxygen (O2) to form water (H2O) and releases heat.

questions.Question: The gas which turns into liquid at the lowest temperature among the following is
questions.solution: Solution:		Liquid hydrogen (LH2) is the liquid state of the element hydrogen. Hydrogen is found naturally in the molecular H2 form. To exist as a liquid, H2 must be cooled below hydrogen’s critical point of 33 K. However, for hydrogen to be in a full liquid state without evaporating at atmospheric pressure, it needs to be cooled to 20.28 K (-423.17 °F/-252.87°C). One common method of obtaining liquid hydrogen involves a compressor resembling a jet engine in both appearance and principle. Liquid hydrogen is typically used as a concentrated form of hydrogen storage

questions.Question: The gas that is used in the manufacture of vanaspati ghee is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Hydrogen gas is used in the manufacture of Vanaspati Ghee.

questions.Question: Which one of the following metals does not react with water to produce Hydrogen ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Cadmium does not react with water to produce hydrogen.

questions.Question: The metal  used to galvanise iron to protect it from rusting is
questions.solution: Solution:		Galvanisation or galvanization (or galvanizing as it is most commonly called) is the process of applying a protective zinc coating to iron or steel, to prevent rusting.

questions.Question: Iron is prevented from rusting by coating with zinc. This process is called as
questions.solution: Solution:		Iron is prevented from rusting by coating with zinc. This process is called as galvanisation.

questions.Question: An electric iron has a heating element made of :
questions.solution: Solution:		Nichrome is Used in an Electric Iron as a heating Element . It is an alloy of Nickel and Chromium with 80 % Nickel and 20 % Chromium. It has a high melting Point of 1400 degree Celsius.

questions.Question: The metal chiefly used for galvanising iron is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Galvanisation or galvanization (or galvanizing as it is most commonly called) is the process of applying a protective zinc coating to iron or steel, to prevent rusting. The most common method is hot dip galvanizing, in which steel sections are submerged in a bath of molten zinc.

questions.Question: The anode in a dry cell consists of
questions.solution: Solution:		A standard dry cell comprises a zinc anode, usually in the form of a cylindrical pot, with a carbon cathode in the form of a central rod. The electrolyte is ammonium chloride in the form of a paste next to the zinc anode.

questions.Question: The common name of sodium bicarbonate is
questions.solution: Solution:		The common name of sodium bicarbonate is Baking soda.

questions.Question: Which among the following stage is suitable indicator when solution of sodium carbonate is mixed with sulphuric acid ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Methyl orange is a pH indicator frequently used in titrations. It is often used in titrations because of its clear and distinct colour change. Because it changes colour at the pH of a mid-strength acid, it is usually used in titrations for acids. In a solution becoming less acidic, methyl orange moves from red to orange and finally to yellow with the reverse occurring for a solution increasing in acidity. The entire colour change occurs in acidic conditions. In an acid it is reddish and in alkali it is yellow

questions.Question: Alum stops bleeding in minor cuts because of
questions.solution: Solution:		Coagulation is the process by which blood forms clots. It is an important part of homeostasis, the cessation of blood loss from a damaged vessel, wherein a damaged blood vessel wall is covered by a platelet and fibrin-containing clot to stop bleeding and begin repair of the damaged vessel. Disorders of coagulation can lead to an increased risk of bleeding (hemorrhage) or obstructive clotting (thrombosis). Alum in block form (usually potassium alum) is used as a blood coagulant. Styptic pencils containing aluminium sulfate or potassium aluminium sulfate are used as astringents to prevent bleeding from small shaving cuts. For example, alum blocks are commonly sold in pharmacies in India.

questions.Question: The chemical name of 'Hypo' commonly used in photography is
questions.solution: Solution:		An emulsion of sodium thiosulfate is called hypo by photographers. It is used to stop development of exposed film. Thiosulfate converts undeveloped silver bromide grains in the film into water-soluble silver thiosulfate complexes that can be removed when the film is washed.

questions.Question: Interveinal necrotic spots on leaves appear due to
questions.solution: Solution:		Injury caused by sulphur oxides show interveinal necrotic areas that are light tan to white. Uninjured tissue next to the veins remains green.

questions.Question: The hardest form of carbon is
questions.solution: Solution:		The allotropes of carbon include graphite, one of the softest known substances, and diamond, the hardest naturally occurring substance.

questions.Question: The most important ore of aluminium is
questions.solution: Solution:		Bauxite is the most common aluminum ore.

questions.Question: The organic reaction represented by equation CH3 - CH = O + H2NOH gives CH3 - CH - NH + H2O is an example of
questions.solution: Solution:		The organic reaction represented by equation CH3 - CH = O + H2NOH gives CH3 - CH - NH + H2O is an example of a condensation reaction.

questions.Question: The number of electrons presents in H+ is
questions.solution: Solution:		H+ is a hydrogen ion, and it is an ion because it LOST an electron. Electrons are negatively charged. When an atom gains electrons it will have NEGATIVE charges.

questions.Question: The hottest part of the gas flame is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		The hottest part of the gas flame is known as luminous zone.

questions.Question: The element used in the manufacture of safety matches is
questions.solution: Solution:		One end of a match is coated with a material that can be ignited by frictional heat generated by striking the match against a suitable surface. The coated end of a match, known as the match "head," contains either phosphorus or phosphorus sesquisulfide as the active ingredient and gelatin as a binder.

questions.Question: This group of alumino-silicate minerals is widely used in making electrical insulators
questions.solution: Solution:		Sheet mica is used principally in the electronic and electrical industries. Its usefulness in these applications is derived from its unique electrical and thermal insulating properties and its mechanical properties, which allow it to be cut, punched, stamped, and machined to close tolerances. Specifically, Mica is unusual in that it is a good electrical insulator at the same time as being a good thermal conductor.

questions.Question: Commercial Vaseline is derived from
questions.solution: Solution:		Vaseline is a brand of petroleum jelly based products owned by Anglo-Dutch company Unilever. While Vaseline can be used as a lubricant, it is also a useful moisture insulator for local skin conditions characterized by tissue dehydration. Vaseline helps protect minor cuts and burns.

questions.Question: Alum is used as
questions.solution: Solution:		It is aluminum potassium sulphate. This is the type of alum that you find in the grocery store for pickling and in baking powder. It is also used in leather tanning, as a flocculant in water purification, as an ingredient in aftershave and as a treatment to fireproof textiles.

questions.Question: Antacid tablets consist of
questions.optionA: Hydroxides of sodium, magnesium and aluminium
questions.solution: Solution:		Most antacids contain at least one of these key ingredients: calcium carbonate, magnesium hydroxide, aluminum hydroxide and/or sodium bicarbonate. And while all these ingredients work to neutralize your stomach's acid, it's important to know more about them so you can choose the one that's right for you.

questions.Question: The chemical used for cloud seeding for artificial rains is
questions.solution: Solution:		The most common chemicals used for cloud seeding include silver iodide, potassium iodide and dry ice (solid carbon dioxide) and Liquid propane. These salt particles act as a core (cloud condensation nuclei or ice-nucleating particles) which draw water vapour within the cloud towards them.

questions.Question: Which of the following is used as anesthetic ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Nitrous oxide (NO), commonly known as laughing gas or happy gas, is the most commonly used inhalation anesthetic in dentistry and is commonly used in emergency centers and ambulatory surgery centers as well. It is an inorganic inhalation agent that is colorless, odorless to sweet-smelling, and nonirritating to the tissues.

questions.Question: Aspirin is chemically known as
questions.solution: Solution:		One of the best known aromatic acetates is acetylsalicylic acid, or aspirin, which is prepared by the esterification of the phenolic hydroxyl group of salicylic acid. Aspirin possesses a number of properties that make it the most often recommended drug.

questions.Question: Gypsum is used for improvement of:
questions.solution: Solution:		Gypsum is calcium sulfate which is essential to the sustainability of most irrigated soils. Irrigated land eventually leads to sodicity and salinity unless extreme care is taken. It improves sodic (saline) soils by removing sodium from the soil and replacing it with calcium.

questions.Question: Which of the following laser types is used in a laser printer?
questions.solution: Solution:		A semiconductor diode laser is currently used in laser printers as the light source.

questions.Question: In which of the following states maximum iron ore is found ?
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Food cans are coated with tin and not with zinc because
questions.optionB: Zinc has a higher melting point than tin
questions.optionC: Zinc is more reactive than tin
questions.optionD: Zinc is less reactive than tin
questions.solution: Solution:		Food cans are coated with tin and not with zinc because zinc is above the tin in reactivity series means more reactive than tin and can react with food elements preserved in it.

questions.Question: Cinnabar is an ore/mineral of
questions.solution: Solution:		Cinnabar, mercury sulphide (HgS), the chief ore mineral of mercury. It is commonly encountered with pyrite, marcasite, and stibnite in veins near recent volcanic rocks and in hot-springs deposits.

questions.Question: The percentage of carbon in cast iron is :
questions.solution: Solution:		The percentage of carbon in cast iron is 3 to 5.

questions.Question: Brass is a solution of molten copper in
questions.solution: Solution:		 'Brass' is a solution of molten copper in Molten zinc. Brass is an alloy of 'copper and zinc'.

questions.Question: The percentage of Nitrogen in Air is
questions.solution: Solution:		The air in Earth's atmosphere is made up of approximately 78 percent nitrogen and 21 percent oxygen. Air also has small amounts of lots of other gases, too, such as carbon dioxide, neon, and hydrogen.

questions.Question: Air is said to be saturated when :
questions.optionA: It contains maximum content of water vapour
questions.optionD: It blows over the barren land
questions.solution: Solution:		Air is said to be saturated when the amount of water vapour in the air is the maximum possible at an existing temperature and pressure. Air is said to be saturated at 100 percent relative humidity when it contains the maximum amount of moisture possible at that specific temperature.

questions.Question: For extinguishing fire, we use
questions.solution: Solution:		For extinguishing fire, we use Carbon Dioxide.

questions.Question: Dry powder fire extinguishers contain
questions.solution: Solution:		Dry powder fire extinguishers contain Sand and sodium bicarbonate.

questions.Question: Dry ice is the solid form of :
questions.solution: Solution:		Dry ice, carbon dioxide in its solid form, a dense, snow like substance that sublimes (passes directly into the vapour without melting) at −78.5 °C (−109.3 °F), used as a refrigerant, especially during shipping of perishable products such as meats or ice cream.

questions.Question: Main pollutant present in automobile exhaust is
questions.solution: Solution:		Carbon monoxide is the main pollutant present in automobile exhaust.

questions.Question: The liquid waste from kitchens and baths, of residences is known as :
questions.solution: Solution:		Sullage is all wastewater generated in households or office buildings from streams without fecal contamination, i.e. all streams except for the wastewater from toilets. Sources of sullage include, e.g. sinks, showers, baths, clothes washing machines or dish washers.

questions.Question: Most poisonous pollutant in water is
questions.solution: Solution:		Most poisonous pollutant in water is arsenic.

questions.Question: Which of the following can be found as pollutants in the drinking water in some parts of India? Select the correct answer using the code given below.(A) Arsenic (B) Sorbitol (C) Fluoride (D) Formaldehyde (E) Uranium
questions.optionB: A, B, C, D and E
questions.solution: Solution:		Recent research has shown that India’s groundwater faces the problem of presence of uranium, arsenic, and heavy metals in ground water used for drinking. Sorbitol (used as artificial sweetener) and Formaldehyde (used in coating, etc) are not famous as water pollutants.

questions.Question: Smog is
questions.optionB: A combination of smoke and fog
questions.optionC: A liquid particle resulting from vapour condensation
questions.solution: Solution:		Smog is air pollution that reduces visibility. The term "smog" was first used in the early 1900s to describe a mix of smoke and fog. The smoke usually came from burning coal. Smog was common in industrial areas, and remains a familiar sight in cities today. Today, most of the smog we see is photochemical smog.

questions.Question: 'Acid rain' is caused due to air pollution by
questions.solution: Solution:		'Acid rain' is caused due to air pollution by Nitrous oxide and sulphur dioxide.

questions.Question: Gas released during Bhopal tragedy was :
questions.solution: Solution:		Over 500,000 people were exposed to methyl isocyanate (MIC) gas. The highly toxic substance made its way into and around the small towns located near the plant. Estimates vary on the death toll. The official immediate death toll was 2,259.

questions.Question: The filter over which sewage is sprinkled is called as
questions.solution: Solution:		A trickling filter, also known as percolating filter, is an artificial bed of stone or broken brick material over which waste water or sewage is allowed to sprinkle or to trickle. It is then collected through the under drainage system.

questions.Question: Main source of lead pollution is from
questions.solution: Solution:		Main source of lead pollution is from leaded gasoline.

questions.Question: An example of major air pollutant is
questions.solution: Solution:		Carbon Monoxide (CO) is one of the most harmful pollutants. Other gaseous air pollutants are carbon dioxide, oxides of sulfur, nitrogen, hydrocarbons, hydrogen sulphide, ozone and other oxidants. Particulate pollutants include mist, dust, smog, fumes etc.

questions.Question: The natural resource, known as black gold is
questions.solution: Solution:		The term "coal is a black gold" is just a simple metaphor. Even today, we burn more coal than natural gas, more than nuclear, more than anything.

questions.Question: The chief constituent of natural gas is:
questions.solution: Solution:		Naturally occurring mixture of a hydrocarbon gas with methane being the primary constituent is called natural gas. Other gases found in minute traces are hydrogen, hydrogen sulphide, nitrogen, carbon monoxide and carbon dioxide.

questions.Question: The resources which can be used continuously, year-after-year are called
questions.solution: Solution:		The natural resources that get replenished in nature are called as the renewable resources. These are the resources that can be used for unlimited time span and can be replaced naturally such as sunlight, water, air etc.

questions.Question: The highest volume of gases in lower atmosphere is comprised of
questions.solution: Solution:		There are a number of atmospheric gases which make up air. In the lower atmosphere or troposphere, the main gases are nitrogen and oxygen, which make up 78% and 21% of the volume of air respectively. The remaining 1% of the atmospheric gases is made up of trace gases.

questions.Question: What is the maximum Water Vapour content in the atmosphere?
questions.solution: Solution:		The maximum water vapour content in the atmosphere is 3 to 4 per cent.

questions.Question: When conc. H2SO4 is added to dry KNO3, brown fumes are evolved. These fumes are due to
questions.solution: Solution:		When conc. H2SO4 is added to dry KNO3, brown fumes are evolved. These fumes are due to NO2.

questions.Question: Wax used for making candle is chemically a mixture of
questions.solution: Solution:		An aliphatic compound is a hydrocarbon compound containing carbon and hydrogen joined together in straight chains, branched trains or non-aromatic rings. Waxes are a class of chemical compounds that are plastic (malleable) near ambient temperatures. Characteristically, they melt above 45 degree C (113 degree F) to give a low viscosity liquid. Waxes are insoluble in water but soluble in organic, non-polar solvents. All waxes are organic compounds, both synthetic and naturally occurring. Waxes are organic compounds that characteristically consist of long alkyl chains. Natural waxes are typically esters of fatty acids and long chain alcohols. Synthetic waxes are longchain hydrocarbons lacking functional groups. Waxes are biosynthesized by many plants and animals. They typically consist of several components, including wax esters, wax acids, wax alcohols, and hydrocarbons. Wax esters are typically derived from a variety of carboxylic acids and a variety of fatty alcohols.

questions.Question: Adding Cl2 to benzene in the presence of AlCl3 is an example of :
questions.solution: Solution:		Adding Cl2 to benzene in the presence of AlCl3 is an example of substitution reaction.

questions.Question: Benzene cannot undergo :
questions.solution: Solution:		Benzene can not undergo elimination reaction.

questions.Question: Which one is the simplest aromatic hydrocarbon?
questions.solution: Solution:		Benzene, C6H6, is the simplest aromatic hydrocarbon and was recognized as the first aromatic hydrocarbon, with the nature of its bonding first being recognized by Kekulé in the 19th century. Each carbon atom in the hexagonal cycle has four electrons to share.

questions.Question: All isotopes of the same element have ________
questions.optionA: Different atomic numbers and different atomic mass
questions.optionB: Different atomic numbers and the same atomic mass
questions.optionC: The same atomic number but different atomic masses
questions.optionD: The same atomic number and the atomic mass
questions.solution: Solution:		All isotopes of the same element have the same atomic number but different atomic masses.

questions.Question: The fundamental particles present in the nucleus of an atom are
questions.solution: Solution:		The nucleus is the positively charged centre of an atom and contains most of its mass. It is composed of protons, which have a positive charge, and neutrons, which have no charge.

questions.Question: J.J. Thomson’s proposed model of atom is generally called ________ model.
questions.solution: Solution:		J.J. Thomson’s proposed model of atom is generally called plum and pudding model.

questions.Question: What particles move around the nucleus of an atom and are negatively charged?
questions.solution: Solution:		Electrons are negatively charged particles that generally orbit the nucleus of an atom. Electrons are much smaller than protons or neutrons.

questions.Question: All isotopes of the same element have ______________
questions.optionA: Different atomic numbers and different atomic mass
questions.optionB: Different atomic numbers and the same atomic mass
questions.optionC: The same atomic number but different atomic masses
questions.optionD: The same atomic number and the atomic mass
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Which one is the most reactive halogen?
questions.solution: Solution:		Fluorine is the most reactive halogen.

questions.Question: Who first published the periodic table?
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1869 Russian chemist Dimitri Mendeleev started the development of the periodic table, arranging chemical elements by atomic mass.

questions.Question: The most suitable vessel for storing concentrated sulphuric acid is
questions.solution: Solution:		Concentrated Sulphuric acid can only be stored in glass, no metal lids, some plastic containers. It will attack anything organic, causing severe burns, the good thing is it will not start a fire but if it goes into contact with a metal it may generate hydrogen gas, an explosion risk.

questions.Question: Which one of the following nonmetals shows allotropy in the liquid state?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sulphur is a non-metal that shows allotropy in the liquid state. If sulphur is heated slowly the changes between the different forms can be observed. These changes are in the form of colour and viscosity (thickness) of the liquid. If the dark brown liquid sulphur is poured into a beaker of cold water, plastic sulphur is formed. This is an elastic, rubber-like form of sulphur.

questions.Question: Sulphuric acid is
questions.solution: Solution:		Sulphuric acid is dibasic.

questions.Question: Chemical name of bleaching powder is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Calcium hypochlorite is an inorganic compound with formula CaO(Cl)2. It is the main active ingredient of commercial products called bleaching powder, chlorine powder, or chlorinated lime, used for water treatment and as a bleaching agent.

questions.Question: The chemical formula of the laughing gas is
questions.solution: Solution:		Nitrous oxide(N2o) is a colourless, sweet-tasting gas. It is also known as "laughing gas".

questions.Question: The common name for the compound having formal NaOH is
questions.solution: Solution:		Sodium hydroxide is also known as lye or soda , or caustic soda. At room temperature, sodium hydroxide is a white crystalline odorless solid that absorbs moisture from the air.

questions.Question: Philosopher’s wool is chemically
questions.solution: Solution:		The compound zinc oxide (ZnO) is called philosopher's wool. Alchemists, as part of their rituals, would burn zinc in air and collect the residue, which formed into white woolly tufts. They called it lana philosophica in Latin, meaning philosopher's wool.

questions.Question: What is the atomic number of Oxygen?
questions.solution: Solution:		The atomic number of oxygen is 8.

questions.Question: Cement is usually a mixture of :
questions.solution: Solution:		Portland cement is the most common type of cement in general use around the world because it is a basic ingredient of concrete, mortar, stucco and most nonspecialty grout. It usually originates from limestone. It is a fine powder produced by grinding Portland cement clinker (more than 90%), a limited amount of calcium sulfate (which controls the set time) and up to 5% minor constituents. Portland cement clinker is a hydraulic material which shall consist of at least two-thirds by mass of calcium silicates, the remainder consisting of aluminium- and iron-containing clinker phases and other compounds.

questions.Question: Sodium bicarbonate is commercially known as
questions.solution: Solution:		Baking Soda is Sodium bicarbonate or sodium hydrogen carbonate. It is primarily used in cooking (baking), as a leavening agent. It reacts with acidic components in batters, releasing carbon dioxide, which causes expansion of the batter and forms the characteristic texture and grain in pancakes, cakes, quick breads, soda bread, and other baked and fried foods.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the main nitrogenous waste in humans ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The excretory system functions in ridding the body of nitrogenous (nitrogen-containing, discussed below) and other wastes. Nitrogenous wastes of animals are excreted in form of ammonia, urea, or uric acid. They are excreted in the urine. Because ammonia is so water-soluble, aquatic animals often can get rid of it just by diffusion into the surrounding water. That’s one reason why the water in your aquarium gets “bad” and needs to be changed, and why not changing the water could kill the fish. However, ammonia doesn’t readily go from body fluids into air, so terrestrial animals need other ways of getting rid of nitrogenous wastes.

questions.Question: Quartz is a crystalline form of
questions.solution: Solution:		Quartz is made up of a continuous framework of SiO4 silicon–oxygen tetrahedra, with each oxygen being shared between two tetrahedra, giving an overall formula SiO2. Tridymite and cristobalite are hightemperature polymorphs of SiO2 that occur in highsilica volcanic rocks. Coesite is a denser polymorph of quartz found in some meteorite impact sites and in metamorphic rocks.

questions.Question: Urea is a
questions.solution: Solution:		Urea is a nitrogenous fertilizer.

questions.Question: Iron and manganese present as pollutants in water cannot be removed by________
questions.optionA: Oxidation followed by settling and filtration
questions.optionD: Lime soda process or manganese zeolite process
questions.solution: Solution:		Water chlorination is the process of adding chlorine or hypochlorite to water. This method is used to kill certain bacteria and other microbes in tap water as chlorine is highly toxic. In particular, chlorination is used to prevent the spread of waterborne diseases such as cholera, dysentery, typhoid etc.

questions.Question: Table salt gets moist during rainy season because
questions.optionC: Sodium chloride contains some quantity of sodium iodide
questions.optionD: Sodium chloride contains hygroscopic impurities like magnesium chloride
questions.solution: Solution:		Table salt is refined salt, which contains about 97 to 99 percent sodium chloride. It usually contains substances that make it free-flowing (anticaking agents) such as sodium aluminosilicate or magnesium carbonate. Because of Hygroscopic nature of salt it become wet in rainy season as the salt absorbs moisture from environment.

questions.Question: The unit to measure the flow of water is
questions.solution: Solution:		The unit to measure the flow of water is cusecs. Cusecs is short form of Cubic feet per second.

questions.Question: When water itself combines chemically with some element or mineral it is called
questions.solution: Solution:		When water itself combines chemically with some element or mineral it is called hydration.

questions.Question: Sea water is saltier than rain water because
questions.optionB: The air around the sea is saltish
questions.optionC: Rivers wash away salts from earth and pour them into the sea
questions.optionD: Sea beds have salt producing mines
questions.solution: Solution:		Sea water is saltier than rain water because river wash away salts from earth and pour them into the sea. Rain water is mostly pure water. Sea water has salt (and other minerals) dissolved in it. Water evaporates from the sea to form clouds (which eventually cause rain) - but the salt is left behind in the ocean. Thus, you can't have salt-water rain.

questions.Question: Saccharin is made up of
questions.solution: Solution:		Saccharin is a non-nutritive or artificial sweetener. It's made in a laboratory by oxidizing the chemicals o-toluene sulfonamide or phthalic anhydride. It looks like white, crystalline powder.

questions.Question: The compound to which H2 does not add is
questions.solution: Solution:		The compound to which H2 does not add is Tetraphenyl ethylene.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a nitrogenous fertilizer ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ca(CN)2 is not a nitrogenous fertilizer.

questions.Question: The pair of compounds used as anaesthetic in medicines :
questions.solution: Solution:		Nitrous oxide is one of the more well-known anesthetic gases, and has been in use for around 200 years. Unlike some other anesthetics, this compound can be used both for inducing unconsciousness and pain control. Chloroform is more potent and more toxic than ether. Its use as an anaesthetic decreased with increased experience and knowledge of its dangers.

questions.Question: Which of the following is used for refrigeration?
questions.solution: Solution:		Common refrigerants used in domestic refrigerators are Freon, neon and nitrogen. It flows through four components of refrigerator again and again.

questions.Question: Chemical name of common salt is
questions.solution: Solution:		Chemical name of common salt is Sodium Chloride.

questions.Question: Nitrogen forms a variety of compounds in all oxidation states ranging from
questions.solution: Solution:		Nitrogen forms a variety of compounds in all oxidation states ranging from –3 to +5.

questions.Question: What is the covalency of nitrogen in ammonia molecule
questions.solution: Solution:		Covalency is the number of covalent bond of an element or compounds. So nitrogen have 3 covalent bond and 1 co ordinate bond. So covalency of nitrogen is 3.

questions.Question: What is 'milk of magnesia' chemically?
questions.solution: Solution:		Magnesium hydroxide is the inorganic compound with the chemical formula Mg(OH)₂. It occurs in nature as the mineral brucite. It is a white solid with low solubility in water. Magnesium hydroxide is a common component of antacids, such as milk of magnesia, as well as laxatives.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is a micro-element ?
questions.solution: Solution:		In analytical chemistry, a trace element or microelement is an element in a sample that has an average concentration of less than 100 parts per million measured in atomic count or less than 100 micrograms per gram. These are those elements essential for plant growth which are needed in only very small (micro). They are: boron (B), copper (Cu), iron (Fe), chloride (Cl), manganese (Mn), molybdenum (Mo) and zinc (Zn).

questions.Question: Which of the following pollutants is main product of automobile exhaust ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Nitric oxide (NO) pollutant is the main product of automobiles exhaust. Nitrogen dioxide (NO2) pollutant is also the product of automobiles exhaust.

questions.Question: The smog is essentially caused by the presence of
questions.solution: Solution:		Photochemical smog is caused by oxides of sulphur and nitrogen.

questions.Question: The depletion in Ozone layer is caused by ________ .
questions.solution: Solution:		Ozone depletion occurs when chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) and halons—gases formerly found in aerosol spray cans and refrigerants—are released into the atmosphere.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the maximum number of electrons that can be present in M-shell?
questions.solution: Solution:		The M shell only holds eight electrons. The M shell can actually hold up to 18 electrons as you move to higher atomic numbers. The maximum number of electrons you will find in any shell is 32.

questions.Question: Atoms of different elements have
questions.optionA: Same atomic number and same electronic configuration
questions.optionB: Different atomic number and same eletronic configu-ration
questions.optionC: Different atomic number and different number of valence electrons
questions.optionD: Same number of electrons and neutrons
questions.solution: Solution:		The atoms of different elements have different numbers of electrons, protons, and neutrons. Every element is unique and has an atomic number. That number tells you the number of protons in every atom of the element. The atomic number is also called the proton number.

questions.Question: The most pure form of Carbon among the options is
questions.solution: Solution:		There are three forms of pure carbon: graphite, coal and diamond. Among coal, Anthracite has the highest carbon content, the fewest impurities, and the highest calorific content of all types of coal except for graphite. Anthracite is the most metamorphosed type of coal in which the carbon content is between 92.1% and 98%.

questions.Question: Carbon footprint can be reduced by
questions.solution: Solution:		Carbon footprint can be reduced by recycling waste materials, using energy efficient appliances and commuting by public transport.

questions.Question: Which of the following gases is most toxic ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Carbon monoxide (CO) is a colourless, odorless, and tasteless gas that is slightly lighter than air. It is toxic to humans and animals when encountered in higher concentrations, although it is also produced in normal animal metabolism in low quantities, and is thought to have some normal biological functions. In the atmosphere it is spatially variable, short lived, having a role in the formation of ground-level ozone. Carbon monoxide is colourless, odorless, and tasteless, but highly toxic. It combines with hemoglobin to produce carboxyhemoglobin, which is ineffective for delivering oxygen to bodily tissues. Concentrations as low as 667 ppm may cause up to 50% of the body’s hemoglobin to convert to carboxyhemoglobin. A level of 50% carboxyhemoglobin may result in seizure, coma, and fatality.

questions.Question: Why is water not suitable for putting out a petrol fire ?
questions.optionA: The oxygen content of water is isolated by petrol and thus it helps in burning
questions.optionB: Petrol is too inflammable to be extinguished by water
questions.optionC: The heat required for combustion of petrol is very low
questions.optionD: Water, being heavy, slips below petrol which thus remains in contact with air and burns
questions.solution: Solution:		Water being heavier than petrol slips down permitting the petrol to rise to the surface and continue to burn. Also, the existing temperature is so high that most of the water poured on the fire evaporates even before it can extinguish the fire.

questions.Question: Which of the following is used as a lubricant in heavy machines?
questions.solution: Solution:		Graphite is used as a lubricant in heavy machines. it is made of carbon atoms arranged in sheets of hexagonal units - looks a lot like chicken-wire. Another sheet forms on top of this and so on. There is no proper connection (in ideal graphite) between the sheets, so they are able to slide freely over each other without breaking any bonds.

questions.Question: The water pollution in river is measured by the dissolved amount of
questions.solution: Solution:		Water pollution in river or any other water body is measured by amount of dissolved oxygen.

questions.Question: Ultraviolet rays can be used in water treatment as
questions.solution: Solution:		UV radiation can be an effective viricide and bactericide. Disinfection using UV radiation is commonly used in wastewater treatment applications and is finding an increased usage in drinking water treatment.

questions.Question: Tar roads get damaged if there is
questions.solution: Solution:		Tar roads gets damaged easily during rainy season. This is because tar roads are prone to water damage very quickly. In the tar road, bitumen plays an important road to create a bond between the aggregate. But, tar road does not give more strength than concrete road, because bitumen respond to heat and water.

questions.Question: Aerated water contains
questions.solution: Solution:		Aerated water is, correctly speaking, water to which air is added. So aerated water is any water artificially impregnated with a large amount of gas (as carbon dioxide). The term is, however, frequently applied to carbonated water.

questions.Question: The BOD values of water indicate the
questions.optionB: Amount of oxygen used for biochemical oxidation
questions.optionC: Amount of oxygen used for biochemical reduction
questions.optionD: Amount of ozone used for biochemical oxidation
questions.solution: Solution:		Clean water has BOD which is less than 5 ppm. If it is equal to or more than 12 ppm, then the water is considered as polluted. So this indicates water be rich in dissolved oxygen, that helps the microorganisms to oxidize inorganic and organic materials.

questions.Question: When lime juice is dropped on baking soda, brisk effervescence takes place because the gas evolved is
questions.solution: Solution:		When baking soda and lemon juice are added together, the reaction of the two is an acid-based reaction because it involves an acid (citric acid in the lemon juice) reacting with a base (sodium bicarbonate, more commonly known as baking soda). Carbon dioxide, a gas, is produced by the reaction.

questions.Question: Which of the following is used as filler in tyre of rubber ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The most common use (70%) of carbon black is as a pigment and reinforcing phase in automobile tires. Carbon black also helps conduct heat away from the tread and belt area of the tire, reducing thermal damage and increasing tire life. Carbon black particles are also employed in some radar absorbent materials and in photocopier and laser printer toner. It is a material produced by the incomplete combustion of heavy petroleum products such as FCC tar, coal tar, ethylene cracking tar, and a small amount from vegetable oil.

questions.Question: The open "Sigrees" or coal stoves often require fanning to sustain burning because of
questions.optionA: Tendency of carbon dioxide to form a layer along with dust smoke
questions.optionB: Lack of oxygen in the surroundings of sigrees
questions.optionC: Accumulation of smoke and dust over the sigrees
questions.optionD: Interrupted release of moisture from the material
questions.solution: Solution:		Burning coal requires oxygen to chemically react. The availability of oxygen is limited in the furnace by several factors such as the friction of the air against the coal. Blowing provides more oxygen to the flame and raises the temperature of the flame. Besides, it helps to prevent carbon dioxide from forming layer along with dust smoke so as to keep the supply of oxygen intact.

questions.Question: 24 carat of diamond is equal to
questions.solution: Solution:		24 carat of diamond is equal to 200 mg.

questions.Question: 1 carat of diamond is equal to
questions.solution: Solution:		1 carat of diamond is equal to 200 mg.

questions.Question: The components of water can be separated by
questions.solution: Solution:		The components of water can be separated by chemical methods.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a chemical reaction?
questions.solution: Solution:		The conversion of water into steam is an example of a physical change, where the state of the matter changes without changing its composition. A physical change involves a change in physical properties. Examples of physical properties include melting, transition to a gas, change of strength, change of durability, changes to crystal form, textural change, shape, size, colour, volume and density.

questions.Question: Chemical formula of washing soda is
questions.solution: Solution:		Chemical formula of washing soda is Na2CO3.10H2O.

questions.Question: What is the chemical name for ‘Baking Soda’ ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sodium bicarbonate is the chemical name for ‘Baking Soda’.

questions.Question: The chemical name of ‘Common salt’ is
questions.solution: Solution:		The chemical name of ‘Common salt’ is Sodium Chloride.

questions.Question: Galvanization is the :
questions.solution: Solution:		Galvanisation or galvanization (or galvanizing as it is most commonly called) is the process of applying a protective zinc coating to iron or steel, to prevent rusting. The most common method is hot dip galvanizing, in which steel sections are submerged in a bath of molten zinc.

questions.Question: Which one of the following metals is used to galvanise iron ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Zinc is used for galvanising iron to protect it from rusting.

questions.Question: A non-electronic conductor is
questions.solution: Solution:		Either the wording of the question is wrong or it doesn’t have a correct option. A non-conductor is a substance which does not allow the passage of electricity. As a general rule, all metals (Iron, Mercury, etc) are good conductors. Nonmetals are non-conductors, except for carbon in the form of graphite and the gas carbon. Copper Sulphate is a good electrolyte (a liquid which allows the passage of electricity). So all the options given in the question are good electrical conductors.

questions.Question: The anode of a dry cell is made up of
questions.solution: Solution:		A standard dry cell comprises a zinc anode, usually in the form of a cylindrical pot, with a carbon cathode in the form of a central rod. The electrolyte is ammonium chloride in the form of a paste next to the zinc anode.

questions.Question: The coating of a thin layer of zinc on steel or iron objects is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		Galvanisation is a process of protecting iron or steel from rusting by coating them with a thin layer of zinc.

questions.Question: Sodium vapour lamps glow with yellow colour. This is due to
questions.optionA: sublimation of sodium to emit yellow colour
questions.optionB: The emission of excess energy absorbed by sodium atoms, in the yellow region of the spectrum
questions.optionC: The low ionisation energy of sodium
questions.optionD: Its ability to absorb all other colours except yellow
questions.solution: Solution:		Sodium Vapour Lamps glow with yellow colour due to the emission of excess energy absorbed by sodium atoms, in the yellow region of the spectrum.

questions.Question: Which amidst the following is not a gem stone ?
questions.solution: Solution:		A gemstone or gem (also called a precious or semiprecious stone, a fine gem, or jewel) is a piece of mineral, which, in cut and polished form, is used to make jewelry or other adornments. However certain rocks (such as lapis lazuli) and organic materials (such as amber or jet) are not minerals, but are still used for jewelry, and are therefore often considered to be gemstones as well. Most gemstones are hard, but some soft minerals are used in jewelry because of their luster or other physical properties that have aesthetic value. Topaz, Opal and Pearl are gemstones but Cat’s-eye is not a gem stone.

questions.Question: Calcium salts used as fertilizer is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Sulphur (as sulphate) is a major plant nutrient, and is essential for crop growth. Calcium Sulphate (gypsum) is used to improve soil quality. Calcium sulphate acts as a pH buffer, which can contribute to neutralizing both soil alkalinity and acidity. It is mainly used for the reclamation of sodic soils through ion exchange (calcium replacing sodium).

questions.Question: Aluminium salt commonly used to stop bleeding is
questions.solution: Solution:		Nitrate (NO3) is the most common form of inorganic nitrogen in unpolluted waters. Nitrate moves readily through soils and into ground water, where concentrations can be much higher than in surface waters. Water in coastal areas mainly contains elementary nitrogen gas (N2).

questions.Question: In silvery paints, the main constituent present is
questions.solution: Solution:		In silvery paints, the main constituent is aluminium powder.

questions.Question: The function of skimming tank in sewage treatment is to remove
questions.solution: Solution:		A skimming tank is a chamber so arranged that the floating matter like oil, fat, grease etc., rise and remain on the surface of the waste water (Sewage) until removed, while the liquid flows out continuously under partitions or baffles.

questions.Question: Acid rain is caused due to emission of which of the following into the atmosphere ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Acid rain is caused by a chemical reaction that begins when compounds like sulphur dioxide and nitrogen oxides are released into the air. These substances can rise very high into the atmosphere, where they mix and react with water, oxygen, and other chemicals to form more acidic pollutants, known as acid rain.

questions.Question: The depletion of Ozone layer is mainly due to
questions.solution: Solution:		The depletion of Ozone layer is mainly due to Chlorofluorocarbons.

questions.Question: Chemical name of vinegar is
questions.solution: Solution:		Vinegar is an aqueous solution of acetic acid and trace chemicals that may include flavorings.

questions.Question: Which one of the following organic compounds has fruity smell?
questions.solution: Solution:		Esters are common in organic chemistry and biological materials, and often have a characteristic pleasant, fruity odour. This leads to their extensive use in the fragrance and flavor industry. Ester bonds are also found in many polymers. Esterification is the general name for a chemical reaction in which two reactants (typically an alcohol and an acid) form an ester as the reaction product. Esters are widespread in nature and are widely used in industry. In nature, fats are, in general, tri-esters derived from glycerol and fatty acids. Esters are responsible for the aroma of many fruits, including apples, durians, pears, bananas, pineapples, and strawberries.

questions.Question: A colloidal system in which a liquid is dispersed in a liquid is called
questions.solution: Solution:		An emulsion is a mixture of two or more liquids that are normally immiscible (nonmixable or unblendable). Emulsions are part of a more general class of two-phase systems of matter called colloids. In an emulsion, one liquid (the dispersed phase) is dispersed in the other (the continuous phase). Examples of emulsions include vinaigrettes, milk, mayonnaise, and some cutting fluids for metal working.

questions.Question: Which is a natural colloid ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Blood is a natural colloid. Sodium chloride solution, cane sugar solution and urea solution are artificially prepared.

questions.Question: Suspension particles have the size between
questions.solution: Solution:		Suspension particles have the size between10-2 and 10-4 cm .

questions.Question: Which of the following acts as best adsorbent?
questions.solution: Solution:		Activated coconut charcoal is a highly absorbent material with millions of tiny pores that can capture, bind, and remove unwanted materials. The porous surface has a negative electric charge that attracts positively charged toxins and gas to be carried easily out of the body. It is used medicinally as well as in air and water purifiers.

questions.Question: Gelatin is mostly used in making ice-creams in order to
questions.optionB: Stabilise the colloid and prevent crystallisation
questions.solution: Solution:		Gelatine, being a colloid, has the property of preventing crystallization. In ice lollies and ice-cream this is demonstrated by the formation of a very fine crystal structure on freezing. This goes much further in that gelatine stabilized ice-cream does not become grainy or sandy due to the slow crystallisation of lactose with time.

questions.Question: Sea water can be purified by the process of
questions.solution: Solution:		Desalination – is a process by which saline water (generally sea water) is converted to fresh water. The most common desalination processes are distillation and reverse osmosis.

questions.Question: A mixture of water and alcohol can be separated by
questions.solution: Solution:		Alcohol can be separated from a mixture of alcohol and water by fractional distillation. This method works because the liquids in the mixture have different boiling points. When the mixture is heated, one liquid evaporates before the other.

questions.Question: Which one is a naturally occuring noble gas?
questions.solution: Solution:		Argon is a naturally occuring noble gas.

questions.Question: Total number of naturally occurring elements
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: The coloured discharge tubes for advertisement mainly contain
questions.solution: Solution:		Neon gives a distinct reddish-orange glow when used in either low-voltage neon glow lamps or in highvoltage discharge tubes or neon advertising signs. The red emission line from neon is also responsible for the well known red light of helium-neon lasers. Neon is used in a few plasma tube and refrigerant applications but has few other commercial uses.

questions.Question: Aspirin is
questions.solution: Solution:		Aspirin is Acetyl Salicilic acid.

questions.Question: Aspirin is common name of
questions.solution: Solution:		Aspirin is common name of Acetyl Salicylic Acid.

questions.Question: By-product obtained by soap industry is
questions.solution: Solution:		By-product obtained by soap industry is glycerol.

questions.Question: Chloroform can be used as
questions.solution: Solution:		Chloroform was once administered by inhalation to produce anesthesia, given to relieve pain, and used as a remedy for cough.

questions.Question: Soap helps in better cleaning of clothes because
questions.optionB: It reduces the surface tension of solution
questions.solution: Solution:		Soap helps to lower the surface tension of solution, thus soap get stick to the dust particles and grease and these are removed by action of water.

questions.Question: The lightest gas which is non-inflammable is
questions.solution: Solution:		The lightest gas which is non-inflammable is helium.

questions.Question: Preparation of ‘Dalda or Vanaspati’ ghee from vegetable oil utilizes the following process :
questions.solution: Solution:		The largest scale application of hydrogenation is for the processing of vegetable oils (fats to give margarine and related spreads and shortenings). Typical vegetable oils are derived from polyunsaturated fatty acids (containing more than one carbon-carbon double bonds). Their partial hydrogenation reduces most but not all, of these carbon-carbon double bonds. Hydrogenation converts liquid vegetable oils into solid or semi-solid fats, such as those present in margarine. Hydrogenation - to treat with hydrogen - is a chemical reaction between molecular hydrogen (H2) and another compound or element, usually in the presence of a catalyst. The process is commonly employed to reduce or saturate organic compounds. Hydrogenation typically constitutes the addition of pairs of hydrogen atoms to a molecule, generally an alkene.

questions.Question: Which among the following is pure matter ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Carbon dioxide is a pure substance, provided there is nothing else in it. A “pure substance” does not mean an element. Rather, it means that the given substance has definite physical and chemical properties. “Pure substances” can be either “Elements” or “Compounds” because all substances belonging to these categories have definite physical and chemical properties. A mixture does not have definite physical and chemical properties, and combine in varying proportions.

questions.Question: The National Chemical Laboratory (India) is located in
questions.solution: Solution:		NCL, India is a research, development and consulting organization with a focus on chemistry and chemical engineering. It has a successful record of research partnership with industryand is located in Pune. NCL belongs to the family of Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), the largest chain of public funded research organization in world. NCL’s human resources comprise of over 1000 people of whom 350 are scientist, 110 are technical staff with advanced degrees in science, technology or engineering. Over 400+ students pursue their doctoral research leading to Ph.D degree. Over 400+ research papers in international journals. Over 70+ Indian and foreign patents granted to NCL.

questions.Question: Who is known as the 'father of modern chemistry'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Antoine Lavoisier is known as the 'father of modern chemistry'.

questions.Question: Which one of the following metals pollutes the air of a city having large number of automobiles?
questions.solution: Solution:		Tetra ethyl lead (C2H5)4 Pb is used as an antiknock compound . It is mixed with petrol to improve its quality. Therefore automobile exhausts lead, which pollutes city.

questions.Question: Pollutant from motor car exhaust that causes mental disease is
questions.solution: Solution:		Lead is the most hazardous metal pollutants of automobile exhausts. Its effects are lead poisoning, anaemia, kidney disease, convulsions and also causes brain damage in children. It also affects central nervous system and distorts the red blood corpuscles.

questions.Question: The most common cause of pollution of air is
questions.solution: Solution:		The most common cause of pollution of air is Sulphur dioxide.

questions.Question: Particulates (< 1 µm size) remaining suspended in air indefinitely and transported by wind currents are called
questions.solution: Solution:		An aerosol is a colloid of fine solid particles or liquid droplets, in air or another gas. The liquid or solid particles have diameter mostly smaller than 1 µm. They remain suspended in air for longer periods of time are transported to distances by winds. The finer particles could also be more easily re-suspended by subsequent wind action.

questions.Question: Mercury is emitted into air by
questions.solution: Solution:		Mercury is emitted into air by burning garbage.

questions.Question: The most reactive among the halogens is
questions.solution: Solution:		Fluorine is the most reactive element of all in Group 7.

questions.Question: Which one element has the lowest electronegativity value
questions.solution: Solution:		The element with the lowest electronegativity value is francium, which has an electronegativity of 0.7.

questions.Question: Which one element has the highest electronegativity value
questions.solution: Solution:		Electronegativity increases from bottom to top in groups, and increases from left to right across periods. Thus, fluorine is the most electronegative element, while francium is one of the least electronegative.

questions.Question: The element with highest ionization potential is
questions.solution: Solution:		The element with highest ionization potential is helium.

questions.Question: Which of the following has no unit?
questions.solution: Solution:		Electronegativity has no unit.

questions.Question: The nuclear particle having no mass and no charge, but only spin is
questions.solution: Solution:		Neutrinos do not carry electric charge, and have mass quite small, though non-zero. Their mass is tiny even by the standards of subatomic particles. They are electrically neutral, weakly interacting elementary subatomic particles with half-integer spin.

questions.Question: The orientation of an atomic orbital is governed by
questions.solution: Solution:		Quantum numbers may be defined as a set of four numbers which give complete information about the electron in an atom, i.e., energy, orbital occupied, size, shape and orientation of that orbital and the direction of electron spin. Magnetic quantum number is required to explain the fact that when the source giving the line spectrum is placed in a magnetic field, each spectral line splits in to a number of lines. The magnetic quantum number tells the number of orientations which the orbitals present within the same sub-shell can take up.

questions.Question: 'Atomic theory' of matter was given by
questions.solution: Solution:		John Dalton (1766-1844) developed the first useful atomic theory of matter.

questions.Question: The most suitable unit for expressing nuclear radius is :
questions.solution: Solution:		The most suitable unit for expressing nuclear radius is Fermi.

questions.Question: The total energy of revolving electron in an atom
questions.optionB: Can have any value above zero
questions.solution: Solution:		The total energy of a revolving electron in any orbit is the sum of its kinetic and potential energies. Energy of an electron at infinite distance from the nucleus is zero. As an electron approaches the nucleus, the electron attraction increases and the energy of electron decreases and thus becomes negative. Thus, it can never be positive.

questions.Question: The nuclear particles which are assumed to hold the nucleons together are
questions.solution: Solution:		Nuclear particles responsible for holding all nucleons together are mesons. To account for the binding forces between like particles such as proton and proton or neutron and neutron, Kemmer suggested the existence of a neutral meson (π0).

questions.Question: The mass of P4O10 that will be obtained from the reaction of 1.33 gram of P4 and 5.07 of oxygen is
questions.solution: Solution:		Balanced chemical equation:P4 + 5O2 --------> P4O101 mol 5 mol 1 mol124g 160g 284gHere limiting reagent is P4.So, 124g of P4 produce P4O10 = 284gTherefore,1.33g of P4 produce P4O10 = (284/124)*1.33= 3.05g

questions.Question: The octane number of zero is assigned to
questions.solution: Solution:		n-heptane is defined as the zero point of the octane rating scale. 2,2,4-Trimethylpentane has an octane rating of 100, whereas n-heptane has an octane rating of 0. The octane number is based on an arbitrary scale which is a measure of its ability to resist knocking, as it burns on combustion.

questions.Question: The metal that is used as a catalyst in the hydrogenation of oils is
questions.solution: Solution:		Although nickel is the preferred catalyst for hydrogenation of fats and oils, the use of other metals such as palladium, platinum, ruthenium, and rhodium leads to products with less trans compounds.

questions.Question: The most abundant rare gas in the atmosphere is
questions.solution: Solution:		The most abundant rare gas in the atmosphere is Argon (Ar).

questions.Question: Normal rainwater is slightly acidic due to the presence of
questions.solution: Solution:		The acidity of rainwater comes from the natural presence of three substances (CO2, NO, and SO2) found in the troposphere (the lowest layer of the atmosphere). As is seen in Table I, carbon dioxide (CO2) is present in the greatest concentration and therefore contributes the most to the natural acidity of rainwater.

questions.Question: Global warming is mainly due to accumulation of
questions.solution: Solution:		Global Warming refers to average increase in the earth’s temperature due to increase in pollution which results in greenhouse effect which in turn leads to climate change. Global warming may lead to rise in the sea level due to melting of glaciers, shrinkage of forests, changes in the rainfall pattern and wide range of impacts on plants and humans. The greenhouse gases such as carbon dioxide accumulate into the atmosphere and trap heat that would normally exit into the outer space.

questions.Question: Main pollutants released from iron and steel industry are
questions.solution: Solution:		Main pollutants released from iron and steel industry are CO, CO2 and SO2.
