It was named so because it can dissolve the so-called royal or noble metals, gold and platinum. However, titanium, iridium, ruthenium, tantalum, osmium, rhodium and a few other metals are capable of withstanding its corrosive properties. Aqua regia is also used in etching and in specific analytic procedures. It is also used in some laboratories to clean glassware of organic compounds and metal particles. This method is preferred over the “traditional” chromic acid bath for cleaning NMR tubes, because no traces of paramagnetic chromium can remain to later spoil acquired spectra.

questions.Question: The tip of the match-stick contains
questions.solution: Solution:		These were sticks with one end made of potassium chlorate and the other of red phosphorus.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a natural dye ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Alizarin or 1,2-dihydroxyanthraquinone (also known as Mordant Red 11 and Turkey Red is an organic compound with formula C14 H8 O4 that has been used throughout history as a prominent red dye, principally for dyeing textile fabrics. Historically it was derived from the roots of plants of the madder genus. In 1869, it became the first natural pigment to be duplicated synthetically.Alizarin is the main ingredient for the manufacture of the madder lake pigments known to painters as Rose madder and Alizarin crimson. Alizarin in the most common usage of the term has a deep red colour, but the term is also part of the name for several related non-red dyes, such as Alizarine Cyanine Green and Alizarine Brilliant Blue.

questions.Question: Poison used for killing rats is
questions.solution: Solution:		Poison used for killing rats is Zinc phosphide.

questions.Question: The chemical used in developing photographic films is
questions.solution: Solution:		In photography, silver bromide is used on photographic film, because it is unusually sensitive to light exposure.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is used as an anti-freeze for the automobile engines ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ethylene glycol is a chemical commonly used in many commercial and industrial applications including antifreeze and coolant. Ethylene glycol helps keep your car's engine from freezing in the winter and acts as a coolant to reduce overheating in the summer.

questions.Question: Mark the compound which possess ionic, covalent and coordinate bonds.
questions.solution: Solution:		Ammonium chloride (NH4) is generally considered as an ionic compound but this compound has three different types of bond. There is ionic bond between NH4+ ion and Cl- ion. There are N-H covalent bonds. The formation of NH4+ from NH3 is sometimes described as the formation of a coordinate bond between NH3 and H+ , however once the bond is formed there is no difference between the four N-H bonds, NH4+ has a tetrahedral structure.

questions.Question: In ice, the number of hydrogen bonds per water molecule is
questions.solution: Solution:		In ice, water can make a maximum of 4 hydrogen bond with the neighbouring water molecule.

questions.Question: Of the following compounds of calcium, the one having highest covalent character is
questions.solution: Solution:		Of the following compounds of calcium, the one having highest covalent character is CaI3.

questions.Question: Which one of the following species has the highest bond order, shortest bond length and maximum bond strength?
questions.solution: Solution:		O+2 has the highest bond order, shortest bond length and maximum bond strength.

questions.Question: The number of hydrogen bonds between guanine and cytosine in DNA is
questions.solution: Solution:		There are two hydrogen bonds between adenine and thymine (A=T) and three hydrogen bonds between cytosine and guanine (G=C).

questions.Question: Freon used as refrigerant is chemically
questions.solution: Solution:		Freon is a trade name for a class of chemicals known as Chlorofluorocarbons or CFC's and are used as a refrigerant in air conditioning systems for homes and automobiles.

questions.Question: The gas used for artificial fruit ripening of green fruit is
questions.solution: Solution:		Ethylene gas, acetylene gas liberated from calcium carbide, and ethephon are some of the commercial ripening agents used successfully in the trade and they have been widely studied for their effectiveness on initiating and accelerating the ripening process and their effect on fruit quality and health related issues.

questions.Question: Which one of the following vegetable oils is used in the manufacture of paints?
questions.solution: Solution:		Linseed oil and castor oils are used mainly as drying agents in paints and varnishes. Linseed oil is generally used in the manufacture of oil paints, drying oil finish or varnish in wood finishing, as a pigment binder in oil paints, as a plasticizer and in the manufacture of linoleum.

questions.Question: KMnO4 can be used as
questions.solution: Solution:		KMnO4 can be used as disinfectant.

questions.Question: A detergent is a
questions.solution: Solution:		A detergent is a cleansing agent.

questions.Question: The metal that is usually extracted from sea water is
questions.solution: Solution:		In the US, 63% of magnesium production came from seawater and brines during 2015. The metal is extracted from seawater and brines by means of electrolysis, a process that requires the passing of a current through a molten salt.

questions.Question: The method of concentrating the ore which makes use of the difference in density between ore and impurities is called
questions.solution: Solution:		Levigation is based on the difference in densities of the metallic ore and gangue particles. Powdered ore is treated with a stream of running water when the lighter gangue particles are washed away and heavier ore particles are left behind.

questions.Question: The inert gases are ____ in water.
questions.solution: Solution:		The inert gases are sparingly soluble in water.

questions.Question: The molecular formula of phosphorous is
questions.solution: Solution:		The molecular formula of phosphorous is P4.

questions.Question: The names of the scientists, Newlands, Mendeleev, and Meyer are associated with the development of
questions.solution: Solution:		They are associated with the development of periodic table of elements. Newland gave the Newland's law of octaves. Mendeleev gave the period law based on atomic mass. Moseley gave the modern period law based on atomic number.

questions.Question: Match the List-I with List-II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the listsList-I (Green house gas)List-II(Major source)F.Carbondioxide1.Enteric fermentation in cattleG.Methane2.Burning of fossilH.Chloroflro carbons3.Mercury compounds in waste waterJ.Nitrous oxide4.Nylon production 5.Air conditioner and refrigeration unitsCodes :FGHJA.2154B.3421C.3241D.1234
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Acid rain is caused by
questions.solution: Solution:		Acid rain is caused by sulphur dioxide and nitrogen dioxide.

questions.Question: The Bhopal gas tragedy was caused by the gas
questions.solution: Solution:		3 leak of toxic methyl isocyanate gas at a Union Carbide plant in the central Indian city of Bhopal produced history's worst industrial disaster, stunning India and the world.

questions.Question: The Bhopal tragedy was caused by the gas
questions.solution: Solution:		3 leak of toxic methyl isocyanate gas at a Union Carbide plant in the central Indian city of Bhopal produced history's worst industrial disaster, stunning India and the world.

questions.Question: Which of the following caused radioactive pollution along the coast of Kerala ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The coastal belt of Karunagappally, Kerala is known for high background radiation from thorium-containing monazite sand. This has increased the risk of cancer in this area. So, the correct answer is 'Thorium'.

questions.Question: Which of the following could be used as fuel in propellant or rockets ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Liquid hydrogen and liquid oxygen are used as propellent for rocket.

questions.Question: Which gas is used for converting vegetable oils into saturated fats ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Hydrogenation - to treat with hydrogen - is a chemical reaction between molecular hydrogen (H2) and another compound or element, usually in the presence of a catalyst. The largest scale application of hydrogenation is for the processing of vegetable oils (fats to give margarine and related spreads and shortenings). Typical vegetable oils are derived from polyunsaturated fatty acids (containing more than one carbon-carbon double bonds). Their partial hydrogenation reduces most but not all, of these carbon-carbon double bonds.

questions.Question: Which of the following gases will effuse out of football bladder most quickly ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Hydrogen gas(H2) will effuse out of football bladder most quickly.

questions.Question: The property of hydrogen which distinguishes it from alkali metals is
questions.solution: Solution:		The property of hydrogen which distinguishes it from alkali metals is that hydrogen is a non - metal while all other members of group 1( alkali metals ) are metals.

questions.Question: Hydrogen is not found in atmosphere because
questions.optionD: It immediately combines with oxygen to form water
questions.solution: Solution:		Hydrogen is a chemical element with symbol H and atomic number 1. With an average atomic weight of 1.00794 u (1.007825 u for hydrogen-1), hydrogen is the lightest element and its monatomic form (H1) is the most abundant chemical substance, constituting roughly 75% of the Universe’s baryonic mass. Nonremnant stars are mainly composed of hydrogen in its plasma state. Air is the name given to the atmosphere used in breathing and photosynthesis. Dry air contains roughly (by volume) 78.09% nitrogen, 20.95% oxygen, 0.93% argon, 0.039% carbon dioxide, and small amounts of other gases. Air also contains a variable amount of water vapor, on average around 1%. Naturally occurring atomic hydrogen is rare on Earth because hydrogen readily forms covalent compounds with most elements and is present in the water molecule and in most organic compounds.

questions.Question: Laughing gas is
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: Electric fuse is an alloy of
questions.solution: Solution:		An electrical fuse is a safety device in the circuit that protects electrical systems by breaking the connection when a short circuit is occurring. The fuse wire is made up of Sn (tin) and Pb (lead) alloy because of its high resistance and low melting.

questions.Question: Detergents used for cleaning clothes and utensils contain
questions.solution: Solution:		Sulphonate is a detergent used for cleaning clothes and utensils.

questions.Question: Which one of the following chemicals helps in fruit ripening?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ethephon helps in fruit ripening.

questions.Question: Which of the following chemicals is used in photography ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Silver halide is the most important chemical used in photographic processing. It is the key component of the emulsion.

questions.Question: Indane gas is mixture of
questions.solution: Solution:		Indane gas is a mixture of butane and propane.

questions.Question: The charcoal used to decolourise brown sugar solution is
questions.solution: Solution:		A brown solution of raw sugar is decolourized when boiled with animal charcoal.

questions.Question: The major component in the LPG is
questions.solution: Solution:		The major component in the LPG is Butane.

questions.Question: Domestic cooking gas consists mostly of
questions.solution: Solution:		Domestic cooking gas consists mostly of Liquified butane and isobutane.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is known as the 'brown coal'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Lignite, often referred to as brown coal, is a soft, brown, combustible, sedimentary rock formed from naturally compressed peat.

questions.Question: The chief source of naphthalene is
questions.solution: Solution:		Most naphthalene is derived from coal tar. From the 1960s until the 1990s, significant amounts of naphthalene were also produced from heavy petroleum fractions during petroleum refining, but today petroleum-derived naphthalene represents only a minor component of naphthalene production.

questions.Question: The gas that usually causes explosions in coal mines is
questions.solution: Solution:		There are two main types of coalmine explosions: methane and coal dust. Methane explosions occur when a buildup of methane gas contacts a heat source and there is not enough air to dilute the gas level below its explosion point.

questions.Question: Submarines move under water. They have engines that run on
questions.solution: Solution:		Early submarines used a direct mechanical connection between the engine and propeller, switching between diesel engines for surface running, and electric motors for submerged propulsion. Diesel electric submarines have a stealth advantage over their nuclear counterparts.

questions.Question: Which is the highest quality of hard coal?
questions.solution: Solution:		Anthracite, often referred to as hard coal, is a hard, compact variety of coal that has a submetallic luster. It has the highest carbon content, the fewest impurities, and the highest energy density of all types of coal and is the highest ranking of coals.

questions.Question: The main source of Naphthalene is
questions.solution: Solution:		Most naphthalene is derived from coal tar. From the 1960s until the 1990s, significant amounts of naphthalene were also produced from heavy petroleum fractions during petroleum refining, but today petroleum-derived naphthalene represents only a minor component of naphthalene production.

questions.Question: Atomic number is the number equal to
questions.solution: Solution:		Atomic number is the number of protons, and therefore also the total positive charge, in the atomic nucleus.

questions.Question: Rutherford’s scattering experiment proved the presence of
questions.solution: Solution:		Rutherford's gold foil experiment demonstrated that almost all of the mass of an atom is in a tiny volume in the center of the atom which Rutherford called the nucleus. This positively charged mass was responsible for deflecting alpha particles propelled through the gold foil.

questions.Question: Number of neutrons in an atom of hydrogen is
questions.solution: Solution:		Number of neutrons in an atom of hydrogen is zero.

questions.Question: The atomic number of carbon is 6 and its atomic mass is 12. How many are there protons in the nucleus of carbon ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The atomic number of carbon is 6 and its atomic mass is 12 then there is 6 protons in the nucleus.

questions.Question: An atom of an element has atomic number 17 and mass number 36. The number of neutrons in its nucleus is
questions.solution: Solution:		An atom of an element has atomic number 17 and mass number 36. The number of neutrons in its nucleus is 19.

questions.Question: Which one of the following acids is used in battery ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The formation of the lead sulphate products involves sulphuric acid, which is the electrolyte used in these batteries. During battery charge, lead sulphate is converted back to lead and lead dioxide, releasing sulphuric acid into the electrolyte.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the strongest base in aqueous solution ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Diethylamine is the strongest base in aqueous solution.

questions.Question: Which of the following acids serves as an electrolyte in a lead storage battery?
questions.solution: Solution:		A 38% solution of sulphuric acid is used as an electrolyte in lead-acid battery.

questions.Question: Which is known as carbolic acid?
questions.solution: Solution:		Phenol is known as carbolic acid.

questions.Question: Citric acid is present in free form in
questions.solution: Solution:		Lemons, oranges, limes, and other citrus fruits naturally possess high concentrations of citric acid. The juice of the lemon is about 5% to 6% citric acid, which gives lemons a sour taste. In fact, Citric acid was first isolated in 1784 by the chemist Carl Wilhelm Scheele, who crystallized it from lemon juice.

questions.Question: Most commonly used bleaching agent is
questions.solution: Solution:		Chlorine is the most commonly used bleaching agent. Bleaching agents are compounds which are used to remove color from substances such as textiles. A bleaching agent is a material that lightens or whitens a substrate through the chemical reaction. The bleaching reactions usually involve oxidative or reductive processes that degrade color systems.

questions.Question: The acid which is secreted by the glands in the stomach wall is
questions.solution: Solution:		The acid which is secreted by the glands in the stomach wall is Nitric acid.

questions.Question: Hydrochloric acid is also known as
questions.solution: Solution:		Hydrochloric acid is also known as Muriatic acid.

questions.Question: Heating of a ore below its melting point in the absence of air is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		Calcination is the process in which the ore is heated below its melting point in absence of air.

questions.Question: Stainless steel is usually made by alloying the steel with
questions.solution: Solution:		Stainless steel is usually made by alloying the steel with chromium and nickel.

questions.Question: The National Chemical Laboratory is situated in
questions.solution: Solution:		National Chemical Laboratory (CSIR-NCL), Pune, established in 1950, is a constituent laboratory of Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR).

questions.Question: Equal masses of oxygen, hydrogen and methane are kept under identical conditions. The ratio of the volumes of gases will be
questions.solution: Solution:		Convert the mass into moles (use the formula n=m/Mr) m = mass and Mr = Molecular weights Molecular weights are 32(Oxygen), 2(Hydrogen), and 16(Methane), respectively. Since the masses are equal, you can take the mass as x. So, the number of moles would be: n(O2) = x/32 n(H2) = x/2 n(CH4) = x/16 The ratio of their volumes is (O2) :(H2) :(CH4) = 1 : 16 : 2

questions.Question: The mass number of an atom is equal to
questions.optionB: the number of protons and electrons
questions.solution: Solution:		The mass number of an atom is equal to the number of nucleons.

questions.Question: The maximum number of covalent formed by nitrogen is
questions.solution: Solution:		Covalency of an atom in a covalent compound is the number of covalent bonds formed by an atom. Maximum covalency of Nitrogen is 4 (example - ammonium ions).

questions.Question: The formula C6H5-CO-CH3 represents
questions.solution: Solution:		The formula C6H5-CO-CH3 represents Acetophenone.

questions.Question: Which of the following compounds is commonly used as an antiseptic in mouthwashes and toothpastes ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Antiseptics are antimicrobial substances that are applied to living tissue/skin to reduce the possibility of infection, sepsis, or putrefaction. Antiseptics are generally distinguished from antibiotics by the latter’s ability to be transported through the lymphatic system to destroy bacteria within the body, and from disinfectants, which destroy microorganisms found on non-living objects. Some antiseptics are true germicides, capable of destroying microbes (bacteriocidal), while others are bacteriostatic and only prevent or inhibit their growth. Antibacterials are antiseptics that have the proven ability to act against bacteria. Microbicides which destroy virus particles are called viricides or antivirals. Sodium chloride,Used as a general cleanser. It is also used as an antiseptic mouthwash.

questions.Question: Soap is prepared by boiling caustic soda with
questions.solution: Solution:		The most basic kind of soap is made from caustic soda and animal fat. The two are heated together, and then cooled. The process is called “saponification”. In technical terms, saponification involves base (usually caustic soda NaOH) hydrolysis of triglycerides, which are esters of fatty acids, to form the sodium salt of a carboxylate.

questions.Question: 'All the four quantum numbers of two electrons in an atom are not the same.' It is the law of –
questions.solution: Solution:		The Pauli Exclusion Principle states that, in an atom or molecule, no two electrons can have the same four electronic quantum numbers. As an orbital can contain a maximum of only two electrons, the two electrons must have opposing spins.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a donor atom?
questions.solution: Solution:		Aluminium is an acceptor atom, an impurity atom in a semiconductor, which can accept or take up one or more electrons from the crystal and become negatively charged.In semiconductor physics. It is a dopant atom that when added to a semiconductor can form a p-type region. For example, when silicon (Si), having four valence electrons, needs to be doped as a p-type semiconductor, elements from group III like boron (B) or aluminium (Al), having three valence electrons, can be used. The latter elements are also called trivalent impurities. Other trivalent dopants include indium (In) and gallium (Ga).

questions.Question: What happens when a chemical bond is formed ?
questions.optionC: More energy is released than is absorbed
questions.optionD: Energy is neither released nor absorbed
questions.solution: Solution:		Energy is always absorbed when a chemical bond is formed.

questions.Question: The most commonly used chemicals in the artificial rainmaking or cloud seeding are
questions.solution: Solution:		The technology sprays particles of salts like silver iodide and chloride on clouds using a special aircraft, rockets or from dispersion devices located on the ground. The most common chemicals used for cloud seeding include silver iodide, potassium iodide and dry ice (solid carbon dioxide) and Liquid propane.

questions.Question: Malathion is a/an
questions.solution: Solution:		Malathion is an insecticide in the chemical family known as organophosphates. Products containing malathion are used outdoors to control a wide variety of insects in agricultural settings and around people's homes. Malathion has also been used in public health mosquito control and fruit fly eradication programs.

questions.Question: The chemical name of rat poison is
questions.solution: Solution:		Zinc phosphide is used as a rodenticide. A mixture of food and zinc phosphide is left where the rodents can eat it. The acid in the digestive system of the rodent reacts with the phosphide to generate the toxic phosphine gas.

questions.Question: Which of the toxic heavy metals is found in modern tannery industries ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Chromium is mainly found in waste from the chrome tanning process; it occurs as part of the retanning system and is displaced from leathers during retanning and dyeing processes. This chrome is discharged from processes in soluble form; however, when mixed with tannery waste waters from other processes (especially if proteins are present), the reaction is very rapid. Precipitates are formed, mainly protein-chrome, which add to sludge generation. If chrome discharges are excessive, the chromium might remain in the solution. Even in low concentrations, it has a toxic effect upon daphnia, thus disrupting the food chain for fish life and possibly inhibiting photosynthesis.

questions.Question: The antiseptic compound present in dettol is
questions.solution: Solution:		The active ingredient in Dettol that confers its antiseptic property is chloroxylenol (C8H9ClO), an aromatic chemical compound. Chloroxylenol comprises 4.8% of Dettol’s total mixture, with the rest composed of pine oil, isopropanol, castor oil soap, caramel and water.

questions.Question: The alkaloid naturally found in coffee, cocoa and cola nut is
questions.solution: Solution:		Caffeine (C8H10N4O2) is a bitter alkaloid found especially in coffee, tea, cacao, and kola nuts.

questions.Question: Formic acid is produced by
questions.solution: Solution:		Formic acid was first isolated from certain ants and was named after the Latin formica, meaning “ant.” It is made by the action of sulfuric acid upon sodium formate, which is produced from carbon monoxide and sodium hydroxide.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is most acidic?
questions.solution: Solution:		Al2O3 is most acidic.

questions.Question: Milk tastes sour when kept in the open for sometime due to the formation of
questions.solution: Solution:		Like many other things, milk contains bacteria, Milk also naturally contains a kind of sugar known as “lactose.” The bacteria that live in milk get energy from this special sugar and use it to reproduce to make even more bacteria. When the bacteria use the lactose sugars to reproduce, they change it from “lactose sugar” into “lactic acid,” which tastes sour.

questions.Question: ________ is used for making vinegar.
questions.solution: Solution:		Acetic acid is used for making vinegar.

questions.Question: The gas used for artificial fruit ripening of green fruit is –
questions.solution: Solution:		Ethylene gas, acetylene gas liberated from calcium carbide, and ethephon are some of the commercial ripening agents used successfully in the trade and they have been widely studied for their effectiveness on initiating and accelerating the ripening process and their effect on fruit quality and health related issues.

questions.Question: The natural source of hydrocarbon is
questions.solution: Solution:		The natural source of hydrocarbon is crude oil.

questions.Question: By which organic compound all the oils are known ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Hydrocarbons are organic compounds containing carbon and hydrogen and found in crude oil and natural gas. Hydrocarbons are formed from the remains of marine animals and plants that lived in shallow inland seas, died, and drifted to the bottom. The term petroleum is used as a common denotation for crude oil (mineral oil) and natural gas, i.e., the hydrocarbons from which various oil and gas products are made.

questions.Question: Which of the following elements is found in all organic compounds?
questions.solution: Solution:		The most common elements present in organic compounds are carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, and nitrogen. With carbon and hydrogen present, other elements, such as phosphorous, sulfur, silicon, and the halogens, may exist in organic compounds.

questions.Question: Ethanol containing 5% water is known as :
questions.solution: Solution:		A rectified alcohol is highly concentrated ethanol which has been purified by means of repeated distillation, a process that is called rectification. It typically contains 95% alcohol by volume and 5 % water. Normally, ethanol with 5 % water is known as pure alcohol.

questions.Question: Petroleum is a mixture of
questions.solution: Solution:		Petroleum is a complex mixture of hydrocarbons that occur in Earth in liquid, gaseous, or solid form.

questions.Question: Which of the following contains high content of lead?
questions.solution: Solution:		A high-octane-rated fuel, such gasoline contains lead. Straight-run gasoline is distilled directly from crude oil. Once the leading source of fuel, its low octane rating required lead additives. Most countries have phased out leaded fuel. Different additives have replaced the lead compounds. The most popular additives include aromatic hydrocarbons, ethers and alcohol (usually ethanol or methanol). Lead used to be added to petrol and this was the source of high levels of lead in the air.

questions.Question: Piped Natural Gas (PNG) is used for
questions.solution: Solution:		LPG is Liquefied Petroleum Gas and PNG is Piped Natural Gas. LPG is supplied in liquid form just as the name suggests in cylinders whereas PNG is supplied through a pipeline. LPG is used as a fuel in heating appliances and vehicles, where as PNG is used for cooking (gas stoves) and heating water (gas geysers).

questions.Question: Petroleum consists of a mixture of
questions.solution: Solution:		Petroleum is a mixture of a very large number of different hydrocarbons; the most commonly found molecules are alkanes (paraffins), cycloalkanes (naphthenes), aromatic hydrocarbons, or more complicated chemicals like asphaltenes.

questions.Question: White coal is
questions.solution: Solution:		White coal is a form of fuel produced by drying chopped wood over a fire.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a renewable source of energy ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Renewable resources include biomass energy (such as ethanol), hydropower, geothermal power, wind energy, and solar energy.

questions.Question: Gobar gas contains mainly :
questions.solution: Solution:		Biogas is the mixture of gases produced by the breakdown of organic matter in the absence of oxygen (anaerobically), primarily consisting of methane and carbon dioxide. The gases methane, hydrogen, and carbon monoxide (CO) can be combusted or oxidized with oxygen.

questions.Question: Gobar gas mainly contains
questions.solution: Solution:		Biogas is primarily composed of methane gas, carbon dioxide, and trace amounts of nitrogen, hydrogen, and carbon monoxide.

questions.Question: The main constituent of biogas is
questions.solution: Solution:		Biogas is primarily composed of methane gas, carbon dioxide, and trace amounts of nitrogen, hydrogen, and carbon monoxide.

questions.Question: An example of replenishable energy source is–
questions.solution: Solution:		An example of replenishable energy source is biomass.

questions.Question: The oil used in the froth floatation process is
questions.solution: Solution:		The oil used in froth flotation process in pine oil, it is because it does not have affinity towards water and it easily attracts impurities and impurities can easily wash away.

questions.Question: The number of waves in n x 10th Bohr's orbit are
questions.solution: Solution:		The number of waves in n x 10th Bohr's orbit are n waves.

questions.Question: The mass of one Avogadro number of helium atom is
questions.solution: Solution:		The mass of one Avogadro number of helium atom is4 x 6.02 x 1023 gram.

questions.Question: The items amenable to detection by soft x-rays are
questions.solution: Solution:		The items amenable to detection by soft x-rays are genuine coins from counterfeit coins.

questions.Question: The material which can be deformed permanently by heat and pressure is called a
questions.solution: Solution:		The material which can be deformed permanently by heat and pressure is called thermoset.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a nitrogenous fetiliser?
questions.solution: Solution:		Superphosphate is not a nitrogenous fetiliser.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is used as a sowing agent in the preparation of soft drinks?
questions.solution: Solution:		Most of soda's acidity also comes from phosphoric acid. Phosphoric acid is made from the mineral phosphorus, which is found naturally in the body. Phosphoric acid gives soft drinks a tangy flavor and prevents the growth of mold and bacteria.

questions.Question: Pyrethrin used in mosquito coil is obtained from
questions.solution: Solution:		Pyrethrin is a natural plant derived substance that comes from the chrysanthemum cinerariaefolium.

questions.Question: What is a common name for the substance which irritates lachrymal glands ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Lacrimal gland, located under the upper eyelid at the outer cornea of the eye, is responsible for tearing during emotional stimulation or following corneal irritation by a foreign body or chemical substance. Tear gas, also called lacrimator, refers to any of a group of substances that irritate the mucous membranes of the eyes, causing a stinging sensation and tears. It produces severe lacrimation by irritating the conjunctivae.

questions.Question: The material used in solar cells contains
questions.solution: Solution:		A solar cell (also called a photovoltaic cell) is an electrical device that converts the energy of light directly into electricity by the photovoltaic effect. Materials presently used for photovoltaic solar cells include mono-crystalline silicon, polycrystalline silicon, amorphous silicon, cadmium telluride, and copper indium selenide/sulfide.

questions.Question: Detergents are
questions.solution: Solution:		detergent is a surfactant or a mixture of surfactants with cleansing properties in dilute solutions. These substances are usually alkylbenzene sulfonates, a family of compounds that are similar to soap but are more soluble in hard water, because the polar sulfonate (of detergents) is less likely than the polar carboxylate (of soap) to bind to calcium and other ions found in hard water.

questions.Question: The metal compound commonly found in Sindhoor or Kumkum is based on
questions.solution: Solution:		Pb3O4 commonly known as red lead is used as sindhoor.

questions.Question: Substance used as an anti freeze in radiators of automobiles is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Methyl alcohol and water are used as an anti-freeze in radiators of automobiles.

questions.Question: Which of the following is used to remove rust stains on cloth?
questions.solution: Solution:		Oxalic acid is used to remove iron and rust stains from clothes.

questions.Question: Which is not an anasthetic agent in surgical operations?
questions.solution: Solution:		Acetone is not an anaesthetic agent in surgical operations.

questions.Question: Heavy metal pollution of water is caused by:
questions.solution: Solution:		Heavy metals (cadmium, cobalt, chromium, copper, mercury, manganese, nickel, lead, zinc, molybdenum, tin) are among the main pollutants. Industrial paints are loaded with metals such as lead, calcium, cadmium and other such chemicals. When any amount of paint is led off into the water bodies it causes water pollution by causing the amount of heavy metals present in water to fluctuate. Each one of these has severe toxic effects on living beings, and tend to accumulate in aquatic food chains.

questions.Question: Ozone layer in the upper parts of the atmosphere serves as a protective shield against harmful
questions.solution: Solution:		The ozone layer is a natural layer of gas in the upper atmosphere that protects humans and other living things from harmful ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun. The ozone layer filters out most of the sun's harmful UV radiation and is therefore crucial to life on Earth.

questions.Question: 'Bhopal gas tragedy' 1984 is related to which gas
questions.solution: Solution:		On December 3 1984, more than 40 tons of methyl isocyanate gas leaked from a pesticide plant in Bhopal, India, immediately killing at least 3,800 people and causing significant morbidity and premature death for many thousands more.

questions.Question: When a nutrient like fertilizer is present in large quantities in a water bodies, plants grow and decay in large numbers because of suffocation of pond that does not leave enough oxygen needed to support life. This type of pollution is called
questions.solution: Solution:		Eutrophication or dystrophication or hypertrophication, is when a body of water becomes overly enriched with minerals and nutrients which induce excessive growth of algae. This process may result in oxygen depletion of the water body after the bacterial degradation of the algae. One example is an "algal bloom" or great increase of phytoplankton in a pond, lake, river or coastal zone as a response to increased levels of nutrients.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the correct sequence of countries in terms of maximum carbon dioxide emission?
questions.solution: Solution:		The correct sequence is China, USA, European Union, India.

questions.Question: Which one among the following is not a mixture?
questions.solution: Solution:		Graphite is not a mixture. This is because graphite is a pure element which cannot split into its constituent particles.

questions.Question: The gas used to dilute oxygen for breathing by deep sea divers is:
questions.solution: Solution:		Trimix is a breathing gas, consisting of oxygen, helium and nitrogen, and is often used in deep commercial diving. The helium is included as a substitute for some of the nitrogen, to reduce the narcotic effect of the breathing gas at depth. It helps to reduce nitrogen narcosis and to avoid the dangers of oxygen toxicity. With a mixture of three gases, it is possible to create mixes suitable for different depths or purposes by adjusting the proportions of each gas.

questions.Question: The most abundant element in the human body is
questions.solution: Solution:		The most abundant element in the human body is oxygen.

questions.Question: The most abundant element in the earth’s atmosphere is
questions.solution: Solution:		Nitrogen is a fairly inert gas at room temperature and is the most abundant element in Earth's atmosphere.

questions.Question: Select the one which is not a mixture :
questions.solution: Solution:		Water (H2O) is the most abundant compound on Earth's surface. Water is a compound because it contains oxygen and hydrogen which are chemically combined in proportion.

questions.Question: The name of unreactive gas is
questions.solution: Solution:		Nitrogen is chemically unreactive because it has a strong triple bond which binds the two nitrogen atoms together making it harder for it to be broken. It does not burn, and at ordinary temperatures it does not react with other elements.

questions.Question: The green colour seen in firework displays is due to the chloride salt of :
questions.solution: Solution:		The red, orange, yellow, green, blue and purple colors exploding in the night sky during a pyrotechnic festival are created by the use of metal salts. Barium chloride provides green colour to firework displays. Metal salts that are commonly used in firework displays include: strontium carbonate (red), calcium chloride (orange), sodium nitrate (yellow), barium chloride (green fireworks) and copper chloride (blue fireworks).

questions.Question: In deep-sea diving, divers use a mixture of gases consisting of oxygen and
questions.solution: Solution:		Air is not the "ideal" breathing mixture for diving as with a concentration of approximately 79 percent nitrogen, compressed air poses two potential problems for all divers: susceptibility to nitrogen narcosis and at deeper depths; and decompression sickness. So divers use Nitrox, a gaseous mixture of nitrogen and oxygen. It is also known as ‘Enriched Air.’

questions.Question: Now-a-days yellow lamps are frequently used as street lights. Which of the following gases is used in these lamps ?
questions.solution: Solution:		A sodium-vapour lamp is a gas-discharge lamp that uses sodium in an excited state to produce light. There are two varieties of such lamps: low pressure and high pressure. Low-pressure sodium lamps are the most efficient electrical light sources, but their yellow light restricts applications to outdoor lighting such as street lamps. High-pressure sodium lamps have a broader spectrum of light but poorer colour rendering than other types. Because sodium vapour lamps cause less light pollution than mercury-vapour lamps, many cities that have large astronomical observatories employ them.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not soluble in water ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Zinc sulphate is not soluble in water.

questions.Question: The chemical that is used to ripen mangoes is
questions.solution: Solution:		Pouches of calcium carbide are placed with mangoes. When this chemical comes in contact with moisture, acetylene gas is produced, the effects of which are similar to ethylene, the one that is naturally used for fruit ripening process.

questions.Question: Exposure to mixtures of chemicals are greater than expected on the basis of effects of exposure to each chemical individually. This is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		When the toxic effect of the mixture is greater than that expected for the sum of individual constituent doses, which is that effects of combined doses are more-than-additive, the interactions are said to be synergistic. Conversely, when the toxic effect of the mixture is less than that expected under the dose additivity assumption, the interactions are said to be antagonistic.

questions.Question: Which of the following is used to remove ink and rust stains on cloth?
questions.solution: Solution:		Oxalic acid is a reducing agent and its conjugate base, known as oxalate, is a chelating agent for metal cations and stain removal. Oxalic acid's main applications include cleaning or bleaching, removal of stains on clothes and the removal of rust.

questions.Question: KMnO4 can be used as a/an
questions.solution: Solution:		KMnO4 can be used as a disinfectant.

questions.Question: The chemical name of 'laughing gas' is
questions.solution: Solution:		The chemical name of 'laughing gas' is nitrous oxide.

questions.Question: Which of the following is used to iodise common salt ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Edible salt can be iodised by spraying it with a potassium iodate or potassium iodide solution.

questions.Question: A thick paste of cement, sand and water is called
questions.solution: Solution:		Mortar is a workable paste used to bind building blocks such as bricks units to fill and seal the gaps. It is a mix of sand, a binder and water.

questions.Question: What is the most commonly used substance in fluorescent tubes?
questions.solution: Solution:		Mercury vapour and argon are the most commonly used substance in fluorescent tubes.

questions.Question: Tear gas is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Tear gas is Carbonyl chloride.

questions.Question: Tetra ethyle lead (TEL) is
questions.optionA: A catalyst in burning fossil fuel
questions.solution: Solution:		Tetra ethyle lead (TEL) is an antiknock compound.

questions.Question: Which of the following is used in making smoke bombs?
questions.solution: Solution:		A smoke bomb is a firework designed to produce smoke upon ignition. Smoke bombs are useful to military units, airsoft games, paintball games, selfdefense and pranks. The smoke bomb was first created in 1848, by the inventor Robert Yale. He developed 17th century Chinese-style fireworks and later modified the formula to produce more smoke for a longer period of time. Coloured smoke devices use a formula that consists of an oxidizer (typically potassium chlorate, KClO3), a fuel (generally sugar), a moderant (such as sodium bicarbonate) to keep the reaction from getting too hot, and a powdered organic dye. The burning of this mixture evaporates the dye and forces it out of the device, where it condenses in the atmosphere to form a “smoke” of finely dispersed particles. A smoke ball is a hollow, cherry-sized sphere of brightly coloured clay or cardboard filled with a smoke-generating composition that produces a forceful jet of coloured smoke for 10 to 15 seconds.

questions.Question: Water gas is the mixture of
questions.solution: Solution:		Water gas is a mixture of carbon monoxide (CO) and hydrogen (H2) produced by passing steam over red-hot coke using the endothermic reaction.

questions.Question: In electro-refining, the pure metal is deposited on
questions.solution: Solution:		In electro-refining, the anodes consist of unrefined impure metal, and as the current passes through the acidic electrolyte the anodes are corroded into the solution so that the electroplating process deposits refined pure metal onto the cathodes. Electrolytic refining is used to extract impurities from crude metals.

questions.Question: Which of the following electrodes is used in strongly alkaline solution?
questions.solution: Solution:		Mercury - mercuric oxide electrode is used in strongly alkaline solution.

questions.Question: The laws of electrolysis are given by
questions.solution: Solution:		Faraday's laws of electrolysis, in chemistry, are quantitative laws used to express magnitudes of electrolytic effects, first described by the English scientist Michael Faraday in 1833.

questions.Question: The most important ore of lead is
questions.solution: Solution:		Lead ore is most commonly found as lead sulphide (PbS), galena, a heavy, shiny grey metallic ore with a conspicuous cubic cleavage, but locally pyromorphite, lead chlorophosphate (Pb5(PO4)3Cl), was worked on Green Hill, near Charterhouse and on Blagdon Hill.

questions.Question: Steel contains
questions.solution: Solution:		Steel contains 0.1 – 5% carbon.

questions.Question: Which is the purest commercial form of iron ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Wrought iron is purest from of commercial iron.

questions.Question: The most abundant metal in the Earth’s crust is
questions.solution: Solution:		The most abundant metal in the Earth’s crust is Aluminium.

questions.Question: The ore of Aluminium is
questions.solution: Solution:		Of all the aluminium ores, bauxite is the chief ore of aluminium.

questions.Question: The element which is used for vulcanizing rubber
questions.solution: Solution:		Vulcanization gives rubber its characteristic elastic quality. This process is carried out by mixing the latex with sulphur (other vulcanizing agents such as selenium and tellurium are occasionally used but sulphur is the most common) and heating it in one of two ways.

questions.Question: Chemically ‘Quick Silver' is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		Quicksilver is an alternative name for the element mercury. A heavy, silvery d-block element, mercury is the only metal that is liquid at standard conditions for temperature and pressure; the only other element that is liquid under these conditions is bromine, though metals such as caesium, gallium, and rubidium melt just above room temperature.

questions.Question: The weight of 6.023 × 1023 atoms of carbon is
questions.solution: Solution:		The number 6.023 ×1023 is known as Avogadro’s Number which is the number of atoms in 12g of the isotope carbon-12. 6.023 ×1023 carbon atoms weigh = 12 grams.

questions.Question: If there is one million Mg2+ ions in MgCl2, how many chloride ions are there?
questions.solution: Solution:		There are two million chloride ions.

questions.Question: What is the mass percentage of carbon in carbon dioxide (CO2)?
questions.solution: Solution:		The mass percentage of carbon in carbon dioxide is 27.3 %.

questions.Question: Which one of the following elements is least likely to be found in commercial fertilisers?
questions.solution: Solution:		Fertilizers typically provide, in varying proportions: (i) six macronutrients: nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), potassium (K), calcium (Ca), magnesium (Mg), and sulfur (S); and (ii) eight micronutrients: boron (B), chlorine (Cl), copper (Cu), iron (Fe), manganese (Mn), molybdenum (Mo), zinc (Zn) and nickel (Ni).

questions.Question: Which of the following is caused by the higher concentration of Nitrogen and Phosphorous ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Higher concentration of Nitrogen and Phosphorus causes Eutrophication.

questions.Question: If the sewage is fully oxidized, the nitrogen is in the form of
questions.solution: Solution:		Oxidized forms of nitrogen include nitrite (NO2) and nitrate (NO3). Nitrogen mainly occurs in wastewater in this form. Because nitrite is easily oxidized to nitrate, nitrate is the compound predominantly found in groundwater and surface waters.

questions.Question: If all bullets could not be removed from gun shot injury of a man, it may cause poisoning by
questions.solution: Solution:		If all bullets could not be removed from gun shot injury of a man, it may cause poisoning by lead.

questions.Question: Extensively used nitrogenous fertilizer is
questions.solution: Solution:		More than 90% of world production of urea is destined for use as a nitrogen-release fertilizer. Urea has the highest nitrogen content of all solid nitrogenous fertilizers in common use. Therefore, it has the lowest transportation costs per unit of nitrogen nutrient.

questions.Question: Which one of the following group of gases contributes to the 'Green House Effect'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Carbon dioxide and Methane contributes to the 'Green House Effect'.

questions.Question: Black lung disease occurs in people working in
questions.solution: Solution:		Coal workers' pneumoconiosis (CWP), commonly known as "black lung disease," occurs when coal dust is inhaled.

questions.Question: The least preferred technique in the disposal of Municipal Solid Waste is
questions.solution: Solution:		Some of the methods of solid waste disposal and management are : ➤ Open burning ➤ Dumping into the sea ➤ Sanitary Landfills ➤ Incineration ➤ Composting ➤ Ploughing in fields ➤ Hog feeding ➤ Grinding and discharging into sewers ➤ Salvaging ➤ Fermentation and biological digestion Bricketting that involves the solidification of preprocessed municipal solid waste into fuel pellets or briquettes is the least preferred method of solid waste disposal.

questions.Question: Which one of the following was used as a chemical weapon in the first world war ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Although the Germans were the first to use phosgene on the battlefield, it became the primary chemical weapon of the Allies. Phosgene was responsible for 85% of chemical-weapons fatalities during World War I. Mustard gas, a potent blistering agent, was dubbed King of the Battle Gases.

questions.Question: The depletion of ozone layer is due to
questions.solution: Solution:		Ozone depletion occurs when chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) and halons—gases formerly found in aerosol spray cans and refrigerants—are released into the atmosphere.

questions.Question: Removal of carbon particles from air involves the principle of
questions.solution: Solution:		Carbon particles in air are colloidal in nature and carry negative charge. The removal of carbon particles from air involves the principle of electrophoresis. Carbon particles get precipitated by losing their charge and, thus, the air which finally comes out is free from them.

questions.Question: Physico-chemical characteristics of water in water sources undergo changes due to
questions.solution: Solution:		Aquatic macrophytes, aquatic fungi are natural organism and evapotranspiration is a natural process by which plant losses water. Thus being natural they do not results into any change in physico-chemical characteristics of water while effluents discharged into water bodies by industrial units and domestic sewage results in to change in physico-chemical characteristics like pH, conductivity, temperature, electrical conductivity, dissolved oxygen, biochemicaloxygen demand, chemical oxygen demand, NH4+ andNO3- ion contents etc.

questions.Question: Sulphur dioxide present in the industrial chimney exhaust causes
questions.optionB: Reduction in plant's productivity owing to acid rain
questions.solution: Solution:		Sulphur dioxide present in the industrial chimney exhaust causes respiratory and lung disease reduction in plant's productivity owing to acid rain and corrosion building materials.

questions.Question: Coating of solid waste with impervious material is known as
questions.solution: Solution:		Containment of toxic or hazardous constituents in industrial solid wastes is currently being accomplished using: (i) coating grains of waste material with an inert and non-reactive impervious material (microencapsulation), and (ii) coating blocks of waste material with an inert, non-reactive impervious material (macroencapsulation).

questions.Question: Taj Mahal is greatly affected due to :
questions.solution: Solution:		When sulphur pollutants fall on to buildings made from limestone and sandstone they react with minerals in the stone to form a powdery substance that can be washed away by rain. This is known as acid rain. Famous buildings like the Statue of Liberty in New York, the Taj Mahal in India and St. Paul's Cathedral in London have all been damaged by this sort of air pollution.

questions.Question: The chemical name of quartz is
questions.solution: Solution:		Quartz is a compound of one part silicon and two parts of oxygen, silicon dioxide, SiO2. Quartz is the most abundant silica mineral. It is used in a number of industries, the important being glass, foundry, sodium silicate, silicon alloys, etc. The various grades of sodium silicate are characterized by their SiO2:Na2O weight ratio.

questions.Question: What is the most common salt in sea water ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sodium chloride is the most common salt in sea water.

questions.Question: Fertiliser having high nitrogen content is :
questions.solution: Solution:		A growth fertilizer will have a high N content and relatively low P and K content. Ammonium nitrate is the highest Nitrogen fertilizer you can buy, and it is potent stuff. It is usually rated as 33-0-0 or 34-0-0. The bag contains 33% or 34% Nitrogen and the other 66% or 67% is inert material. Other formulations of growth fertilizers will contain 5, 6 or even 7 times more Nitrogen than anything else.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is found in kidney stones?
questions.solution: Solution:		The most common type of kidney stone is a calcium oxalate stone. These result when the urine contains low levels of citrate and high levels of calcium and either oxalate or uric acid. Calcium oxalate stones are linked with foods high in oxalate, which is a naturally occurring substance in plants and animals.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is not present in cement ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Gypsum is added in calculated quantity in order to adjust the rate of setting of cement. Alum is not present in cement.

questions.Question: The iron ore magnetite consists of
questions.solution: Solution:		The iron ore magnetite consists of Fe2O3.

questions.Question: The ionisation energy of hydrogen atom in the ground state is x KJ. The energy required for an electron to jump from 2nd orbit to 3rd orbit is
questions.solution: Solution:		The ionisation energy for the hydrogen atom can be writtenas: Ionisation energy = energy in first orbit - energy in infinite orbit Ionisation energy = ​ E = -E0 / n2 ,where E0  = 13.6 eV (1 eV = 1.602×10-19 Joules) and n = 1,2,3… and so on.The difference in energy = Einfinity - E1so the ionisation energy from the ground state = x KJ = 0-( -E0 /12 ) = E0The energy required to jump the elctron from second to the third stage is:

questions.Question: The major constituent of air is
questions.solution: Solution:		Below a height of about 86 kilometers, the three main gaseous elements, which together account for about 99.9% of the total atmosphere, exist in essentially constant proportion to the total: nitrogen comprises 78% of air by volume, oxygen comprises 21% of air by volume, and argon comprises another 0.9%.

questions.Question: The main chemical constituent of clay is
questions.solution: Solution:		Aluminium silicate is the main Chemical constituent of clay.

questions.Question: The mineral containing both magnesium and calcium is
questions.solution: Solution:		The mineral containing both magnesium and calcium is Dolomite.

questions.Question: An example of heterocyclic compound is
questions.solution: Solution:		The most common heterocycles are those having five- or six-membered rings and containing heteroatoms of nitrogen (N), oxygen (O), or sulfur (S). The best known of the simple heterocyclic compounds are pyridine, pyrrole, furan, and thiophene.

questions.Question: In organic compounds, nitrogen is estimated by
questions.solution: Solution:		Duma's method can be used to estimate nitrogen in all type of organic compounds. Detection of nitrogen is done by Lassigne's test. Estimation of phosphorus is done by Carius method.

questions.Question: Heavy metals got their name because compared to other atoms they have
questions.solution: Solution:		Arsenic, beryllium, cadmium, chromium, lead, manganese, mercury, nickel, and selenium are some of the metals called ‘heavy’ because of their high relative atomic mass. They persist in nature and can cause damage or death in animals, humans, and plants even at very low concentrations.

questions.Question: Which one of the following elements exhibits the greatest tendency to lose electrons ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Alkali metals such as Lithium are the most electropositive elements in the periodic table. As alkali metals have low ionization energies, they have a great tendency to lose electrons forming uni-positive ions.

questions.Question: Which one is heaviest naturally occurring element of the periodic element?
questions.solution: Solution:		The heaviest naturally stable element is uranium, but over the years physicists have used accelerators to synthesize larger, heavier elements. In 2006, physicists in the United States and Russia created element 118.

questions.Question: London smog is found in
questions.solution: Solution:		London smog is found in winter during morning time.

questions.Question: Photo chemical smog is a resultant of the reaction among
questions.optionA: High concentration of NO2, O3, and CO in the evening
questions.optionB: CO, CO2 and NO2 at low temperature
questions.optionC: CO, O2 and peroxy acetyl nitrate in the presence of Sunlight
questions.optionD: NO2, O3 and peroxy acetyl nitrate in the presence of Sunlight
questions.solution: Solution:		Photochemical smog is a unique type of air pollution which is caused by reactions between sunlight and pollutants like hydrocarbons and nitrogen dioxide (NO and NO2). Other components of the photochemical smog include Ozone (O3) formaldehyde, peroxy benzoyl nitrate (PBzN), peroxy acetyl nitrate (PAN) and acrolein.

questions.Question: The gas involved in Bhopal incident was
questions.solution: Solution:		3 leak of toxic methyl isocyanate gas at a Union Carbide plant in the central Indian city of Bhopal produced history's worst industrial disaster, stunning India and the world.

questions.Question: Which of the following chemicals is responsible for depletion of ozone layer in the atmosphere?
questions.solution: Solution:		Chlorofluorocarbons is responsible for depletion of ozone layer in the atmosphere.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a method/process of disposing of solid waste which cannot be reused or recycled ?
questions.solution: Solution:		All of the above are process of disposing of solid waste which cannot be reused or recycled.

questions.Question: Water cycle refers to
questions.optionA: An integrated attempt to recycle water in relatively arid regions
questions.optionB: Constant movement of water from ocean to land and back to ocean once again
questions.optionC: Scientific management of water in areas excessively plagued with water-logging
questions.optionD: Water distribution in relatively dry areas
questions.solution: Solution:		Water cycle, also called hydrologic cycle, cycle that involves the continuous circulation of water in the Earth-atmosphere system. Of the many processes involved in the water cycle, the most important are evaporation, transpiration, condensation, precipitation, and runoff. Although the total amount of water within the cycle remains essentially constant, its distribution among the various processes is continually changing.

questions.Question: Permanent hardness of water may be removed by addition of
questions.solution: Solution:		Hardness can be removed by adding sodium carbonate (washing soda) or by passing the water through an ion-exchange column.

questions.Question: Acid rain is caused due to pollution of atmosphere by
questions.solution: Solution:		Acid rain is caused by a chemical reaction that begins when compounds like sulphur dioxide and nitrogen oxides are released into the air. These substances can rise very high into the atmosphere, where they mix and react with water, oxygen, and other chemicals to form more acidic pollutants, known as acid rain.

questions.Question: What are the components responsible for acid rain?
questions.optionD: Oxides of carbon (COx) and Oxides of nitrogen (NOx)
questions.solution: Solution:		Sulphur dioxide (SO2) and Nitrogen oxides (NOx) are responsible for acid rain.

questions.Question: Which gas emitted by power stations causes acid rain?
questions.solution: Solution:		Power plants release the majority of sulphur dioxide and much of the nitrogen oxides when they burn fossil fuels, such as coal, to produce electricity. In addition, the exhaust from cars, trucks, and buses releases nitrogen oxides and sulfur dioxide into the air. These pollutants cause acid rain.

questions.Question: The gas dissolved in water that makes it basic is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Ammonia gas that dissolves in water forms a solution of ammonium hydroxide (NH4OH). This solution (including the gas) is a strong base and will make the solution alkaline.

questions.Question: Which of the following acts as promoter for iron in Haber's process?
questions.solution: Solution:		Molybdenum (Mo) acts as promoter for the catalyst iron.

questions.Question: One property of ammonia is
questions.optionD: Its aqueous solution turns red litmus blue
questions.solution: Solution:		The main use of litmus is to test whether a solution is acidic or basic. For instance, ammonia gas, which is alkaline, colours the red litmus paper blue.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is used for dating very old objects of archaeological importance?
questions.solution: Solution:		Radiocarbon dating (usually referred to as simply carbon dating) is a radiometric dating method that uses the naturally occurring radioisotope carbon-14 (14C) to estimate the age of carbon-bearing materials up to about 58,000 to 62,000 years. After plants die or they are consumed by other organisms (for example, by humans or other animals), the incorporation of all carbon isotopes, including 14C, stops. Thereafter, the concentration (fraction) of 14C declines at a fixed exponential rate due to the radioactive decay of 14C.

questions.Question: In which of the following substances all carbon atoms are quaternary in nature ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Carbon atoms in diamond are quaternary in nature. The crystal structure of a diamond is a face-centered cubic or FCC lattice. Each carbon atom joins four other carbon atoms in regular tetrahedrons (triangular prisms). Based on the cubic form and its highly symmetrical arrangement of atoms, diamond crystals can develop into several different shapes, known as ‘crystal habits’.

questions.Question: Atomic number of an atom gives the number of which of the following ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Atomic number of a chemical element is the number of protons found in the nucleus of an atom of that element, and therefore identical to the charge number of the nucleus. It determines the place of an element in the periodic table. In an uncharged atom, the atomic number is also equal to the number of electrons.

questions.Question: The chemical bahaviour of an atom depends upon
questions.optionA: The number of protons in its nucleus
questions.optionB: The number of neutrons in the nucleus
questions.optionC: The number of electrons orbiting around the nucleus
questions.optionD: The number of nucleons in the nucleus
questions.solution: Solution:		The chemical behavior of atoms is determined by the number and the configuration of the electrons in the atom.

questions.Question: Which one of the following has a maximum tendency to form M3 ion ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The general electronic configuration of group 15 elements (N, P, As, Sb and Bi) is ns2np3. Since Nitrogen has smallest size and greatest electronegativity in the family, it may gain three electrons and attain noble gas configuration, forming nitride N3- ions. The other members show little tendency to form tri-negative M3- ions. Their electronegativity is so low that they would generally form covalent compounds even with highly electropositive elements.

questions.Question: A matured mammalian cell without nucleus is
questions.solution: Solution:		Mammalian erythrocytes are unique among the vertebrates as they are non-nucleated cells in their mature form. These cells have nuclei during early phases of erythropoiesis, but extrude them during development as they mature in order to provide more space for hemoglobin. In mammals, erythrocytes also lose all other cellular organelles such as their mitochondria, Golgi apparatus and endoplasmic reticulum.

questions.Question: Which of the following metals can displace copper from copper sulphate solution ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Iron metal is more reactive than copper. Therefore, it can displace copper from copper sulphate (CuSO4) solution. Cu is less reactive than iron, therefore, cannot replace iron from iron sulphate (FeSO4).

questions.Question: Froth floatation process to concentrate the minerals is applicable to
questions.solution: Solution:		Froth floatation process to concentrate the minerals is applicable to Chalcopyrites.

questions.Question: Chemical name of Gammaxane is
questions.solution: Solution:		Some elements behave chemically both as metals and nonmetals, and are called metalloids. Their examples include Boron, Silicon, Germanium and Antimony. Elements which are neither metals nor nonmetals are called Noble Gases.

questions.Question: Epsom salt is used
questions.solution: Solution:		Epsom salt is used as purgative.

questions.Question: The metal extracted from Bauxite is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Aluminium ore is called bauxite . The bauxite is purified to produce aluminium oxide, a white powder from which aluminium can be extracted.

questions.Question: Among the following iron ores, the highest percentage of iron content is found in–
questions.solution: Solution:		Hematite, also spelled haematite, heavy and relatively hard oxide mineral, ferric oxide (Fe2O3), that constitutes the most important iron ore because of its high iron content (70 percent) and its abundance. Its name is derived from the Greek word for “blood,” in allusion to its red colour. Many of the various forms of hematite have separate names. The steel-gray crystals and coarse-grained varieties have a brilliant metallic lustre and are known as specular iron ore; thin scaly types are called micaceous hematite. Much hematite occurs in a soft, fine-grained, earthy form called red ochre or ruddle. Intermediate between these types are compact varieties, often with a reniform surface (kidney ore) or a fibrous structure (pencil ore). Red ochre is used as a paint pigment; a purified form, rouge, is used to polish plate glass. The most important deposits of hematite are sedimentary in origin. The world’s largest production (nearly 75 million tons of hematite annually) comes from a sedimentary deposit in the Lake Superior district in North America.

questions.Question: A potato tuber has been cut into two halves. A few drops of iodine solution are placed on the cut surface of one of the halves. What colour change will be noticed?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Iodine test is used to test for the presence of starch. Iodine solution — iodine dissolved in an aqueous solution of potassium iodide — reacts with the starch producing a purple black colour.

questions.Question: An electrochemical cell which is used as a source of direct electrical current at constant voltage under standard conditions is called a :
questions.solution: Solution:		A Galvanic cell, also known as battery, is an electrochemical cell that derives electrical energy from spontaneous redox reactions taking place within the cell. It is typically used as a source of electrical power. By their nature, they produce direct current. A battery is a set of galvanic cells that are connected in parallel.

questions.Question: The metals commonly used for electroplating are
questions.solution: Solution:		The metals commonly used for electroplating are Chromium, Copper and Nickel.

questions.Question: In galvanization, iron is coated with
questions.solution: Solution:		Galvanisation or galvanization (or galvanizing as it is most commonly called) is the process of applying a protective zinc coating to iron or steel, to prevent rusting. The most common method is hot dip galvanizing, in which steel sections are submerged in a bath of molten zinc.

questions.Question: The process of improving the quality of rubber by heating it with sulphur is called
questions.solution: Solution:		The process of improving the quality of rubber by heating it with sulphur is called vulcanization.

questions.Question: Which of the process is known as nitrification?
questions.optionA: Reaction of Nitrogen Monoxide with oxygen to form nitric acid
questions.optionB: Reaction of nitrogen dioxide with water to form nitric acid
questions.optionD: Conversion of nitrite to nitric oxide
questions.solution: Solution:		Nitrification is the process by which ammonia (NH3) or ammonium (NH4+) is converted to nitrate (NO3-).

questions.Question: Which is not a green house gas ?
questions.solution: Solution:		N2O is not a green house gas.

questions.Question: Formation of ozone hole is maximum over
questions.solution: Solution:		Ozone holes are formed in Antarctica and these are due to special clouds that form in the stratosphere called polar stratospheric clouds. Clouds usually do not form in stratosphere, this can happen only at such low temperatures. These clouds accumulate pollutants resulting in formation of ozone holes.

questions.Question: Ozone saves the biosphere by absorbing high energy radiations called ________ .
questions.solution: Solution:		The ozone layer or ozone shield is a region of Earth’s stratosphere that absorbs most of the Sun’s ultraviolet (UV) radiation. It absorbs 97 to 99 percent of the Sun’s medium-frequency ultraviolet light (from about 200 nm to 315 nm wavelength), which otherwise would potentially damage exposed life forms near the surface.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is not a cause for present global warming and climate change ?
questions.solution: Solution:		Deforestation is not a cause for present global warming and climate change.

questions.Question: The gas used for artificial ripening of green fruit is
questions.solution: Solution:		Ethylene gas, acetylene gas liberated from calcium carbide, and ethephon are some of the commercial ripening agents used successfully in the trade and they have been widely studied for their effectiveness on initiating and accelerating the ripening process and their effect on fruit quality and health related issues. Green fruits are ripened by ethylene gas.

questions.Question: Zone refining is used for the purification of
questions.solution: Solution:		Zone refining is a very useful method to get metals with very high purity such as silicon and germanium. It is also referred to as zone melting, floating zone process, and travelling melting zone.

questions.Question: The main chemical constituent of the oil of cardamom which is responsible for flavour of this oil is
questions.solution: Solution:		The main chemical constituent of the oil of cardamom which is responsible for flavour of this oil is cineole.

questions.Question: The molecule which has the highest percentage of ionic character among the following is
questions.solution: Solution:		HF has the highest percentage of ionic character because F has the greatest electronegativity. F, Cl, I, and Br are all in the same group so that means their electronegativity (and thus percentage of ionic character) decreases as they go down the group in the periodic table.

questions.Question: The high reactivity of fluorine is due to
questions.solution: Solution:		The high reactivity of fluorine is due to its high electronegativity.

questions.Question: Oxygen has (+) oxidation number only in
questions.solution: Solution:		In case of OF2, oxygen is not the most electronegative element. The fluorine is more electronegative and has an oxidation state of -1. In this case, the oxygen has an oxidation state of +2.

questions.Question: The oxidation number of nickel in K4[Ni(CN)4] is
questions.solution: Solution:		The oxidation number of nickel in K4[Ni(CN)4] is zero.

questions.Question: How many neutrons are there in 92U238 atom ?
questions.solution: Solution:		The atomic number of uranium is 92, and the mass number of the isotope is given as 238. Therefore, it has 92 protons, 92 electrons, and 238 — 92 = 146 neutrons.

questions.Question: The number of neutrons present in an element having mass number 226 and atomic number 88 is :
questions.solution: Solution:		The mass number is a count of the number of particles in an atom's nucleus which is made up of protons and neutrons. In other words, Mass Number = Number of Protons + Number of Neutrons. The atomic number is the number of protons in an atom of an element, i.e., 226 = 88 + number of Neutrons. So, the number of neutrons= 226 – 88= 138.

questions.Question: Who modified Bohr's theory by introducing elliptical orbits for electron path?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sommerfeld modified Bohr's theory. According to him electrons move in elliptical orbits in addition to circular orbits.

questions.Question: High concentration hydrocarbon pollutants in atmospheric air causes
questions.solution: Solution:		High concentration hydrocarbon pollutants in atmospheric air causes cancer.

questions.Question: Which one is not a primary greenhouse gases in the Earth's atmosphere?
questions.solution: Solution:		Nitrogen is not a primary greenhouse gases in the Earth's atmosphere.

questions.Question: Which of the following is secondary air pollutant ?
questions.solution: Solution:		SO2 is secondary air pollutant.

questions.Question: Sullage water is –
questions.solution: Solution:		Sullage is domestic wastewater other than that which comes from the toilet. It results from food preparation, personal washing, and washing of cooking and eating utensils and clothes. It is also called greywater (to distinguish it from blackwater which describes wastes containing human excrete).

questions.Question: The gas liberated in the Bhopal gas tragedy was:
questions.solution: Solution:		The scenes were reminiscent of the 1984 Bhopal gas disaster which killed thousands of people. At least 30 tonnes of methyl isocyanate gas was released from the Union Carbide pesticide plant in the Madhya Pradesh capital in one of the worst industrial disasters of the 20th century.

questions.Question: Ozone layer of atmosphere absorbs:
questions.solution: Solution:		The ozone layer or ozone shield is a region of Earth's stratosphere that absorbs most of the Sun's ultraviolet radiation. It contains a high concentration of ozone in relation to other parts of the atmosphere, although still small in relation to other gases in the stratosphere.

questions.Question: Air shows the property of
questions.solution: Solution:		Air is mixture of different types of gases therefore it also shows the property of gases like Nitrogen and Oxygen.

questions.Question: The most abundant constituent of atmospheric air is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Air is the name given to the atmosphere used in breathing and photosynthesis. Dry air contains roughly (by volume) 78.09% nitrogen, 20.95% oxygen, 0.93% argon, 0.039% carbon dioxide, and small amounts of other gases.

questions.Question: The percentage of oxygen in air is approximately
questions.solution: Solution:		It's a mixture of different gases. The air in Earth's atmosphere is made up of approximately 78 percent nitrogen and 21 percent oxygen. Air also has small amounts of lots of other gases, too, such as carbon dioxide, neon, and hydrogen.

questions.Question: The major constituent of air is
questions.solution: Solution:		Below a height of about 86 kilometers, the three main gaseous elements, which together account for about 99.9% of the total atmosphere, exist in essentially constant proportion to the total: nitrogen comprises 78% of air by volume, oxygen comprises 21% of air by volume, and argon comprises another 0.9%.

questions.Question: The drug ‘Marijuana’ is a
questions.solution: Solution:		The drug ‘Marijuana’ is a sedative.

questions.Question: The Refrigerant 'FREON' is
questions.solution: Solution:		Dichlorodifluoromethane (R-12), is a colourless gas, and usually sold under the brand name Freon-12, is a chlorofluorocarbon halomethane (CFC), used as a refrigerant and aerosol spray propellant. Complying with the Montreal Protocol, its manufacture was banned in the United States along with many other countries in 1994 due to concerns about damage to the ozone layer. It is soluble in many organic solvents. It can be prepared by reacting carbon tetrachloride with hydrogen fluoride in the presence of a catalytic amount of antimony pentachloride. This reaction can also produce trichlorofluoromethane (CCl3F), chlorotrifluoromethane (CClF3) and tetrafluoromethane (CF4).

questions.Question: The chemical(s) most commonly used for cloud seeding or ‘artificial rainmaking’ is/are
questions.optionC: Dry ice or frozen carbon dioxide
questions.solution: Solution:		The most common chemicals used for cloud seeding include silver iodide, potassium iodide and dry ice (solid carbon dioxide). Liquid propane, which expands into a gas, has also been used.

questions.Question: 'Fire-fighting clothes' are made from
questions.solution: Solution:		Bunker Gear or "Turnout Gear" are terms used by many firefighters to refer to their system of outer protective clothing. Fire fighter used to be made of asbestos in the past. Because of its carcinogenic properties and other harmful effects, it has slowly been replaced by other substitutes. Fire-fighting and working clothes and accessories for firemen, rescuers and industrials made of materials FR cotton, Nomex, Modacryl, FR viscose and others.

questions.Question: Trinitrotoluene is
questions.solution: Solution:		Trinitrotoluene, or more specifically 2,4,6-trinitrotoluene, is a chemical compound. This yellow solid is occasionally used as a reagent in chemical synthesis, but it is best known as an explosive material with convenient handling properties.

questions.Question: Stains of rust on clothes can be removed by :
questions.solution: Solution:		Rust stains can be a challenge to remove because the stain consists of tiny iron oxide particles. Acidic solutions work best for these stains. The important ingredient in these removers is an acid - usually oxalic or hydrofluoric acid. The remover ingredients combine with the iron and loosen it from the fabric, then hold it in suspension in the wash water.

questions.Question: One of the constituents of tear gas is
questions.solution: Solution:		Chloropicrin is a colourless liquid that is insoluble in water, with which it is stable. With a vapor pressure of 24 mm Hg, its volatility is between that of phosgene and mustard gas in persistency, although closer to phosgene because it is related to the compound. Tests have shown that chloropicrin causes humans to shut their eyes involuntarily. Chloropicrin can be absorbed systemically through inhalation, ingestion, and the skin. It is severely irritating to the lungs, eyes, and skin. Because of these properties, chloropicrin can only be delivered in shell form as a chemical weapon.
